La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche entre otros productos,la socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza por catalogo,ella vende lapiz labiales,perfumes y cremas,la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos de belleza como lapiz labiales,cremas y perfumes.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Celestina continues selling groceries. She sells essential supplies, such as rice, sugar and milk. Along with this, she sells beauty products by catalogue, such as lipsticks, perfumes and creams. She works from 6:00 am until 8:00 pm. Her dream is to expand her groceries store.

She is now requesting a loan to buy beauty products, such as lipsticks, creams and perfumes.

She greatly appreciates the loan, because it will help her improve her quality of life. She promises to pay the installments in time.

loans.use: to buy beauty products like lipsticks, creams and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando a su casa ella sigue cuidando a sus nietos,la socia es un amujer emprendedora y muy trabajodora,ella recibe un sueldo de su jubilacion,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The borrower continues to be devoted to her home and is still looking after her grandchildren. She is an enterprising and very hard-working woman. She receives a retirement pension, and her dream is to have a grocery store. She is applying for the loan in order to buy a television for her home.

She appreciates the loan she will be granted, and is forever grateful. In this way she will be able to improve her quality of life. As well, she promises to make her installment payments on time.

loans.use: To buy a television for her home.

loans.name: Amparo De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Amparo tiene 62 años de edad. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a realizar los oficios domesticos y a la crianza de especies menores, como aves; tiene dos años de dedicarse a esto, lo aprendio gracias a un proyecto que llego a su comunidad y les regalaron cinco gallinas y desde entonces le gusto y decidio continuar con el proyecto por su propia cuenta. Hoy en dìa posee varios pollos de engorde, ademas administra su propia tienda de productos de la canasta bàsica.

Los pollos los adquiere en la ciudad, se tarda veinte minutos a pie hasta llegar al lugar donde aborda el autobus. El prèstamo que esta solicitando a Fundaciòn Campo, es para comprar 100 pollos de engorde y cinco sacos de concentrado para alimentarlos. Su deseo es continuar trabajando para recibir ingresos que le sirvan para su sostenibilidad y construir una galera para que los pollos esten en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Amparo is 62 years old.  She is an enterprising, hardworking person who is dedicated to domestic chores and raising small animals such as birds.  She has been engaged in this business for two years and learned it thanks to a project that came to her community.  Participants were given five hens to raise and she enjoyed it, so she decided to continue the project on her own.  Today, she has several broiler chickens, and she also manages her own store where she sells staple goods.

She purchases the chickens in the city, and it’s a twenty minute walk to the bus stop.  She will use the loan she is requesting from Fundaciòn Campo to purchase 100 broiler chicken and five sacks of concentrated feed.  Her dream is to continue working to earn income to support herself, and to build a shed to improve conditions for the chickens.

loans.use: to purchase 100 broiler chicken and five sacks of concentrated feed.

loans.name: Aleyda Patricia

texts.es:
Aleyda tiene 32 años de edad, es casada desde hace 10 años y tiene dos hijos, una niña y un niño. lleva dos años dedicandose a la elaboraciòn y venta de pupusas en el negocio de una señora. Pero hoy en dia ella quiere instalar su propia pupuseria. 

El prèstamo que esta solicitando a Fundaciòn Campo, es para comprar una plancha e insumos para elaborar las pupusas. De esta manera ella mejorara considerablemente los ingresos familiares, lo que le ayudara para mantener su negocio y que sea el màs preferido en la zona.
texts.en:
Aleyda is 32 years old, has been married for ten years, and has two children: a boy and a girl.  She has spent two years earning a living by making and selling "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas) in another lady's business.  But now she wants to set up her own "pupuseria" (a place where stuffed tortillas are made).

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is for buying a grill and supplies for making the pupusas.  In this way she will considerably improve her family's income, which will help her maintain her business and make it the most preferred in the area.

loans.use: to buy a grill and supplies for making stuffed tortillas.

loans.name: Mirna Morelia

texts.es:
Mirna tiene 56 años de edad, es viuda y tiene cinco hijos. Ella vive con sus tres hijos menores, los dos mayores viven fuera del paìs. Mirna tiene màs de cinco años de dedicarse al cuido de ganado, debido a que cuando murio su esposo se hizo cargo de todos los gastos del hogar con ayuda de sus hijos. Para comprar los animales se traslada al tiangue que esta a veinte kilometros de su casa.

El prèstamo que esta solicitando a Fundaciòn Campo, es para comprar dos vacas en lactancia. Con el objetivo de aumentar la cantidad de leche disponible para venderla y para vender guajada. Lo que ella pretende es procesar la leche para elaborar queso, crema y venderlos. Ella desea enseñarles a sus hijos todo lo bueno para que ellos sean buenas personas.
texts.en:
Mirna is a 56 year old widow, and she has five children.  She lives with her three minor children; the two oldest live outside of the country.

Mirna has been taking care of livestock for over five years.  When her husband died she took charge, with help from her children, of all of the household expenses.  She goes to Tiangue, which is 20 kilometers from her house, to buy the animals.

The loan that she is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy two lactating cows.  Her objective is to increase the amount of available milk to sell and to sell curds.  She intends to process the milk in order to make cheese and cream to sell.  She wants to teach her children everything good so that they will become good people.

loans.use: to buy two lactating cows.

loans.name: Sughara

texts.en:
Sughara, 41, is the mother of four children. For 20 years, she has been running a milk sales business. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family; her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time, her sales increased, and so did her income. She now has thirteen buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. 

Because of her work, Sughara is respected in her home. She helps her husband in both family matters and financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to the Kashf Foundation for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Nem's Group

texts.en:
Nem, 50, resides in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is married and has five children, some of whom are assisting in the family’s business, which is growing rice. To gain income for the family, Nem and her husband have worked as rice farmers for ten years, together earning around 10,000 KHR each day, from which they can save around 3,000 KHR for future expenses. 

Nem is a second-time borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The previous loans that Nem received helped her to secure food for her family, which made her so satisfied. Now she is leading a female group member, also a second-time borrower with VisionFund, to apply for a loan in the amount of 1,200,000 KHR each. With part of her portion of the loan, Nem will buy fertilizer to apply to her farmland; she will use the rest to cover the passport fees for some of her children, so they can work in Malaysia as paid workers.With the help of this loan, Nem hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Enaydina

texts.es: Enaydina de 37 años vive al lado de su pareja, Carlos de 41 años. Juntos habitan en una humilde propiedad construida a base de adobe. Su actividad principal es la agricultura, cultivando achiote , café, cacao entre otros. A ella le agrada mucho saber que su pareja siempre ha estado a su lado, trabajando todos los días, muy dedicados a sus cultivos para obtener ingresos constantemente. Actualmente desea invertir en la renovación de las plantaciones de cacao, pues estos ya cumplieron su ciclo de vida y es necesario cambiarlos. En lo posterior buscará la manera de ampliar sus plantaciones a mayor rango debido a que la demanda del cacao esta en optimas condiciones hasta hoy. Este es su crédito número 04 y está muy tranquila al saber que existe una entidad que confía en ella y le da las facilidades del caso. Con los 2,000 ya esta programando la compra de plantas de almacigo de cacao, para reemplazar los antiguos.
texts.en: Enaydina, 37, lives with her partner Carlos, 41. The live together in a humble home made from adobe. Their main activity is agriculture, growing achiote, coffee, cacao, and other crops. It pleases her to know that her partner has always been by her side, working every day, very dedicated to their crops so that they will have a consistent income. Now she wants to invest in renewing the cacao fields. These have already finished their life cycle and need to be changed. Later, she will look for a way to make her fields larger, since the demand for cacao is optimal right now. She is her fourth loan, and she is very content knowing that there is an entity that trusts her and gives her the resources she needs. With the 2,000 PEN she is planning to buy cacao seedlings to replace the old ones.

loans.use: to buy cacao seedlings.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Ms. Bushra is a 22-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good customer list. Her husband is Labor, and he earns insufficient income to support their family alone. 

Bushra is a mother of four children. She is motivated to provide for her family. Because she wants to grow her business, she is in her 2nd loan cycle.  This cycle, she wants to take a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy stocks of rice, flour, and canteen material from the market at lower prices. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand for these items, consistently.

loans.use: To buy stocks of rice, flour, and canteen material from the market at lower prices.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Ms Abida is a 36-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the past three years. She offers various goods for daily use at reasonable prices. She has gained a good list of regular customers. Her husband is employed in a small furniture factory and earns insufficient income alone to support their family. 

Abida is a mother of 4 children. She is motivated to provide for her family. Because she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower prices. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand for these items, consistently. She wishes to use part of her profits to deal with personal expenses, and part to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To buy stock of rice and flour from the market, at lower prices.

loans.name: Nora Elia

texts.es: La Sra. Nora Elia tiene la edad de 52 años de edad es soltera y tiene 2 hijos ella se dedica ala venta de ropa usada en su hogar ya tiene 3 años a dedicarse a esta labor, es la primera ves que esta institución le pretende dar un préstamo en esta ocasión desea este préstamo para la compra de mercancía de ropa usada desea  contar con el apoyo de kiva.
texts.en: Mrs. Nora Elia is 52 years old. She is single and has 2 children. She sells second hand clothes at her home. She has been doing this for 3 years and this is the first time that the financing institution is going to grant her a loan. On this occasion she wants the loan to buy second hand clothes merchandise and wishes to have the support from kiva.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes merchandise.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda de 38 años, vive a lado de su esposo Teodoro, de 46 años. Ambos se esfuerzan para darles lo mejor a sus dos hijas. Juntos habitan en una casa de material noble, que construyeron con tanto esfuerzo. hace más de 20 años, Nilda vio en la agricultura el único recurso para sustentar su hogar y salir adelante, como siempre el apoyo de su esposo ha sido imprescindible. Sus tierras son muy fértiles, logrando producir una variedad de productos agrícolas en su mayoría, cacao, producto de buena demanda en los últimos años. Lamentablemente sufrió el robo de sus productos en más de una ocasión, por parte de inescrupulosos que extraen sus plantanciones. Ahora se encuentra en temporada de cacao, y es necesario realizar el mantenimiento debido a sus cultivos, como por ejemplo, sacar la maleza, fertilizar y reforzar los limites de su terrenos, para evitar el ingreso de extraños. En esta ocasión, su préstamo numero 18 será de 2,000 soles, con ello comprará sacos de abono orgánico y contratar jornaleros, para que construyan la cerca de su terreno.
texts.en: Nilda, 38, lives with her husband Teodoro, 46. They both work hard to give the best to their two daughters. They live together in a house made of hard-wearing materials, that they built with a lot of effort. More than 20 years ago, Nilda saw farming as the only way to maintain her household and move forward. As always, the support of her husband has been essential. Their land is very fertile. It has produced a variety of crops, but mostly cacao, a product that has been in high demand in recent years. Sadly, their crops have been stolen on more than one occasion, by unscrupulous people who remove their plantings. Now it is cacao season, and she has to carry out needed maintenance on the crops, such as weeding, fertilizing, reenforcing the boundaries of their land to prevent strangers from entering. Her 18th loan will be for 2,000 soles. With this money, she will buy bags of organic fertilizer and hire day laborers, so that they can build a fence on their property.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer and hire day laborers.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 49-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making sweets at her home for eight years. She lives with nine family members and is motivated to provide them with good, quality food and education, and to keep them healthy.

She contributes a lot to the family income because she has become well-known in her town for providing good, quality tasting sweets, and she gets many orders for special occasions.

In order to complete the orders on time, Azra requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to add to her stock by buying sugar and packs of flavor for taste. She hopes that her income will increase and desires to spend the earned profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: To buy sugar and packs of flavor for taste to add to her stock

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Ms. Fozia is a 36-year-old woman. Four years ago, she started her own business of clothing sales, after her husband had divorced her. She is a very hard-working lady. She didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation, upon the advice of her neighbor, to initiate her own business. She buys clothes of different designs from markets, in bulk at lower rates, and resells them at retail in her community. She counts a good customer list; most of her customers are her neighbors. She has gradually improved her business, using several loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a variety of clothes for the winter season. She expects a boost in her profits through her larger sales. She wishes to use the earned profit on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fish to add to her stock

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: La Sra. María concepción tiene la edad de 56 años es casada tiene un hijo, ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio de tortillas de harina desde hace un año que cuenta con este pequeño negocio en esta ocasión desea el negocio para la compra de  mercancía para ampliar un poco mas este negocio y así tener mas ventas incrementadas.
texts.en: Señora María Concepción is 56 years old, married, and has one son.  For a year she has had a small flour tortilla businesss, and she relies on this small business.  Now she wants the loan to purchase merchandise in order to expand her business a little more and to have increased sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha de 41 años, lleva consigo un feliz matrimonio con Dionicio de 40 años. Juntos tienen 5 hijos.  Actualmente habitan en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad. Hace 10 años que se dedica a la producción de cacao, y esto es gracias al tipo de suelo que tiene su terreno, muy fertil, dándole buenos resultados en la producción. Ella se siente muy a gusto con su trabajo, y más el oler los granos de cacao guardados en un pequeño almacén que habilitó en su casa, pues eso la motiva a seguir trabajando. Por otra parte, en la ultima temporada de cosecha de cacao, hubo un pequeño porcentaje de cacao que no logro ser comercializada debido a que detecto una enfermedad conocida como “escoba de bruja” que arruina a algunas plantas. Ante esto, necesita que sean reemplazadas. Por tanto tiene pensado plantar árboles de cacao. Este es su crédito número 07 y desde ya se encuentra muy contenta con esta nueva oportunidad de crédito pues le permite como siempre realizar una buena inversión para beneficio de ella y su familia, por otro lado comenta que se siente muy comprometida con su banco comunal y en las decisiones que tomen. Gracias al préstamo por 2,000 soles adquirirá plantas de almacigo de cacao y sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
41-year-old Bertha has a happy marriage with 40-year-old Dionicio.  Together they have five children.  Now they live in an adobe house that is their own property.  For ten years she has made a living by producing cocoa, and thanks to the type of soil her land has, which is very fertile, it has given her good production results.  She feels very pleased with her work and being able to smell the cocoa beans kept in a small store that she set up in her house, so this motivates her to keep working.  On the other hand, during the last cocoa harvesting season there was a small percentage of cocoa that she did not manage to sell because she detected a disease known as "escoba de bruja" (Witch's Broom, which is caused by a fungus) that ruined some plants.  Given this, she needs them to be replaced.  Therefore she has planned to plant cacao trees.  

This is her seventh loan and she is already very happy with this new loan opportunity because, as always, it allows her to make a good investment to the benefit of her and her family.  On the other hand, she says that she feels very committed to her communal bank and the decisions they make.  Thanks to the loan for 2,000 soles she will acquire cocoa seedling plants and sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy cocoa seedlings and sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Moussiliate

texts.fr: Agée de 30ans, Moussiliate est mariée et mère de quatre enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. Elle a une boutique où elle vend des mèches et des tissages de différentes qualités depuis 05ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du bénin et de l'extérieur. Dans le but de renforcer son fonds de roulement et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev afin de maximiser son intérêt et de participer à la bonne éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Moussiliate, 30 years old, is married and has four children in school. The eldest is 10 years old, and the youngest two. She has a store where she has been selling hair extensions and hair weaves of various quality grades for five years. She stocks up at one of Benin markets and out of the country. With the goal of bolstering her working capital and meeting customer demand, she has requested and obtained financing from Finadev, so as to maximize her revenues and help provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy 50 packs of hair extensions and 50 packs of hair weaves of various quality grades.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, a married man who lives in Changamwe, Kenya, owns a carpentry shop. He started the business fifteen years ago. He has continued to supply finished wood works to customers who live in the area. He is a married father of four children, three of whom are in school. He employs three other people in the business.

Samuel was introduced to Milango by his friend and decided to join in order to access credit. He is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenyan shillings to purchase timber and machines. His main challenges are inflation and competition. Samuel has set his sights on owning a large store or factory in the future, where he will deal in or make wood works.

He will use the extra income he earns by investing his loan, to invest for his family's future needs and also to pay for the school fees of his children.

loans.use: To purchase timber and machines.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a resident of Malindi, Kenya and runs a food cafe which has been running for two years. He is single. He also owns a transport business, providing motorcycle transportation.

Despite the challenge of foods perishing, Gabriel aspires to own a larger shelter from which to sell the food. Gabriel learned of Milango from his friends and is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenyan shillings to purchase more foodstuffs, such as beans, rice, flour, etc. He also desires to move to a new, larger venue where he can use gas for cooking.

Gabriel believes the additional income from this loan will help him to build a house and start a family.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs e.g. beans, rice, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Kret's Group

texts.en:
Kret, who resides in a rural area of Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district of Cambodia, is 64 years of age and married with five children. To generate income for the family, Kret and his wife farm rice and plant cassava, the business in which they have been involved for more than 40 years. This enables them to earn around 20,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day and save only approximately 3,000 KHR after deducting the daily cost of living. 

Kret, a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is leading a group member who also is a first-time borrower with VisionFund to apply for a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. Kret will utilize his loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor fees. Via the help of this loan portion, he believes that his business will provide good quality crop yields so that he can sell them at good prices, earning more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for labor fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom, 55, is married with three children. His family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district. The main sources of his family’s income are working as a motor-taxi driver in the village, while his wife sells grocery items. Sokhom and his wife have been running their business for five years, earning about 15,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day, and he is able to save about 3,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses.

Sokhom’s group consists of four members who live in the same village. He received his first loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund four loan cycles ago and has effectively used it to sustain his family’s business, support his family’s needs and save some money from the earnings for the future. 

Sokhom is now leading his group to ask for a loan of 600,000 KHR each. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy more grocery items for his wife’s business. He hopes this loan will enable his family to earn more income from the current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for his wife’s business.

loans.name: Chaingoun's Group

texts.en:
A 43-year-old married woman, Chaingoun is a villager residing in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, in Cambodia. She has seven children, of whom five daughters are under her responsibility. Chaingoun and her husband earn their living through farming rice and planting cassava, the business in which they have been involved for more than twenty years.  They are able to earn approximately 12,000 KHR per day and manage to save around 4,000 KHR, after paying their daily expenses. 

Chaingoun is leading a group member to apply for a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR, each. For both of them, this will be their first time requesting a loan from VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Chaingoun, the group leader, will use her loan portion to purchase fertilizer to apply to her farmland. This hard-working woman would be very happy to be able to receive the loan portion that she has requested. Via the help of this loan portion, Chaingoun believes that her business will provide her with good quality crop yields so that she can boost her income and better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Siphorn's Group

texts.en:
Siphorn, 35, is married and living in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. She has three children to take care of, all of whom are dependents and still in school. 

She has been farming rice and planting vegetables for fifteen years. With her hard work, she manages to earn about KHR 60,000 per day and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs after deducting daily expenses.

This is the fourth loan for Siphorn with VisionFund. She fully repaid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her current business. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan of KHR 600,000 each. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor fees. Siphorn hopes to increase her crop yields and sell it for a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with thatched walls in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Chreb is aged 37 years and married. She has no kids. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and working for others for fees. Having been in this business for 10 years, Chreb is able to earn about 14,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day, and she can save about KHR 3,000 each day for future needs. 

Chreb has been a member of VisionFund for four loan cycles already, and she successfully repaid the loans, which have helped her better support her family’s living expenses. Now, she is leading her group of five members to request a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Chreb will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and will use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to grow her current business so as to increase her family’s income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager living in Takeo province’s Bati district, Saret is aged 46 years and married with two children, both of whom are dependents. One is in school while the remaining one is a garment worker to help support the family. 

Saret is a rice farmer who has been farming rice on 1.3-hectares of farmland for twenty-one years to make a living, while her husband is a soldier in the local area. Saret can earn about KHR 25,000 per day from the current business and manage to save KHR 10,000 daily for future needs. Drought is the main challenge for her paddy-field. 

Saret’s group consists of four members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle. She fully paid back the past loan, which has helped her relieve her family’s burden. 

Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Saret, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor fees. 

She hopes to increase her farming production to generate more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sinak's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Takeo province’s Bati district, Sinak is 51, and she is a widowed mother of four children. All her children are dependents, and work for others for a fee in the local area, earning additional income for the family. 

For more than 18 years, she has been farming rice on one-hectare of farmland as the primary source of the family’s income.  She can earn about KHR 70,000 per day, and manages to save about KHR 30,000 each day, after offsetting daily expenses, for future needs.

Sinak has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle, and has fully paid back the loan. She wisely and successfully used the first loan to make her living conditions better. 

Now Sinak is leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland, and will use a portion of it on labor fees. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and timely to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide, as well as for labor fees, for her farmland.

loans.name: Chamroen's Group

texts.en:
Chamroen, 47, lives with her husband and seven children in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. Of her seven children, she still has four children to take care of; some are in school and some work as paid construction workers in the local area to earn additional income for the family.

To feed the family, Chamroen and her husband earn a living as farmers. They have been farming rice for several years. Besides this, she also sells vegetables such as cabbage, beans, Chinese kale, etc. for several years, earning about 20,000 KHR per day to spend on the family’s needs.

Chamroen’s group consists of five members and she is the fifth. She completely paid back the past loans with VisionFund. She has successfully used the loans to improve her family’s living standard and keep her children in school.

Now leading her group to request another loan, Chamroen, the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Ty's Group

texts.en:
Ty, 55, lives with her family members in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She has five children, one of whom is dependent and helps the family’s business. 

For the last twenty years, she and her husband have been farming rice as the primary source of the family’s income to make a living. The current business earns them about 10,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Lack of working capital is the main challenge for operating her farming business.

Ty’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. She has been with VisionFund for nine cycles. She completely paid back the past loans, which have constantly supported her family with enough foods and basic necessities. 

Now she and her group member are applying for a loan of 500,000 KHR each. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for gasoline. She hopes to make more fruitful rice so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Lov's Group

texts.en: One of the breadwinners in a family with four children, Lov is 62 years old and married. She has struggled to manage the household through rice cultivation. With 20 years' experience in this business, she is able to earn about 44,000 KHR per day and save about 16,000 KHR per day. This is the first-cycle loan for Lov with Kiva partner, VisionFund. She forms a group of two -- her fellow group member is in the second loan cycle -- to seek a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. Lov, the leader, will use her entire portion of the loan to buy rice seed. She greatly hopes that she can grow her rice paddy on time, so that she can earn profit for her children's sake.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: Maurita

texts.es:
Con 34 años, Maurita se esfueza mucho para ver a sus hijas Alexandra de 13 años y Daleska de 9, convertirse en profesionales. La vida le enseñó, según cuenta, en ser la única defensora de su hogar, permitiendole alcanzar grandes metas, una de ellas es terminar de construir su vivienda. Al lograr obtener la confianza de MFP logró desde hace 3 años aperturar su negocio dedicado a la venta de útiles de escolares y de oficina que fue complementando con accesorios y suministros informáticos debido a la gran demanda.
Sus dos pequeñas hijas, siempre están con ella y apoyan ya sea en actividades menores lo cual hace de su trabajo un gran motivo de unión familiar.
En circunstancias recibe pedidos por parte de entidades que en ocasiones presentan retraso en el pago, generándole grandes inconvenientes  a la hora de hacer el balance de sus ganancias. pero se nota un incremento considerable en la venta al por menor, es por ello que planea realizar la compra de mercadería y accesorios informáticos de ultima gama para así satisfacer la demanda. Lleva 14 préstamos con MFP con el cual ha logrado desempeñarse con mucha confianza cumpliendo así con sus pagos de manera puntual. Le agrada trabajar con su banco comunal ya que sus compañeros en su mayoría son personas que conoce desde niña y eso le inspira mucha confianza. 
Con los 1,000 soles realizará la compra suministros informáticos como audífonos, parlantes  y otros logrando así abastecer la demanda actual de su negocio.
texts.en:
Maurita is 34 years old. She works hard to help her daughters Alexandra, 13 years old, and Daleska, 9 years old, become professionals. She explains that life taught her to be her home's only supporter, which has allowed her to reach great goals. One of these goals is to finish building her home. After getting support from MFP, the field partner, she managed to open her business dedicated to school and office supplies 3 years ago. She has complemented the sales with computer supplies and accessories due to the high demand for these.
Her two young daughters are always with her and help her with minor tasks, which makes her work a source of family union. 
Sometimes she receives orders from entities that occasionally are late with their payments, which causes her problems when balancing her accounts. However, she has observed a considerable increase in retail sale and this is why she plans to buy cutting edge computer accesories and merchandise to satisfy the demand.
She has had 14 loans with the field partner so far and has done well, fullfilling her payments on time. She enjoys working with her communal bank because most of her colleagues are people she has known since she was a child and she feels she can trust them. With the 1,000 nuevos soles she will buy computer supplies such as headphones, loudspeakers and other items to satisfy the current demand in her business.

loans.use: to buy computer equipment supplies such as headphones and loudspeakers

loans.name: Noen's Group

texts.en:
Noen is 52 and a widowed mother of one dependent daughter who works as a paid construction worker in the local area to better support the family. Her family lives in a village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, making a living farming rice. Having been in this business for twenty years, Noen is able to earn about 14,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 4,000 KHR each day, after deducting daily expenses.

Noen is an existing client of VisionFund who has received loans for three cycles and has paid them back in full. The past loans have helped relieve the family's financial burden to a great extent.

She is now leading a group of four members to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on land-plowing and labors.

With this loan, Noen hopes to produce more crops and sell them for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Simorn's Group

texts.en:
Simorn is 63 and married with six children. Living in a village of the Kandal Stoeng district, Simorn and her husband grow rice as the family's main source of income. Having been in the farming business for ten years, they manage to earn about 17,000 KHR per day to feed their family.

Simorn’s group consists of three members. This is her fifth loan with VisionFund. She completely repaid the past four loans, which have enabled her family to have enough food.

Now she is leading her group to request another loan of 600,000 KHR each. Simorn will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and will spend a portion on labor fees for transplanting rice seedlings. Simorn hopes this loan will enable her to grow a healthy and fruitful crop of rice so as to sell it for a good price and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny is a woman who heads a family; she has four children. She and her entire family are living in Battambang Province's Moung Russey district. Her main sources of income are from rice farming and pineapple planting, in which she has engaged for 15 years. Her prior loan, which she has paid back with success and relieved her family's burden, was her first loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. 

Now, Ny and two of her co-members are seeking to borrow 1,000,000 KHR each, whereas the remaining group member is applying for 600,000 KHR. Ny, the group leader, will use her loan portion entirely for purchasing fertilizer for both parcels of her farmland. She believes that this fertilizer purchase will boost her income and keep up her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for both of her parcels of farmland.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Kim, 56, is a widowed mother living with her child in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She makes a living through farming rice. She has been in this business for 27 years, earning about KHR 26,000 per day. She is able to save about KHR 10,000 each day, after expenses, for future needs. 

Kim’s group consists of three members who live in the same village, and she is in her first microloan with Kiva partner VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Kim, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She will also use a portion of it to spend on labor costs in plowing the paddy-field. Through this loan, she hopes to get a high yield from her farming business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland, and for labor costs to plow.

loans.name: Thhy's Group

texts.en: Thhy, a 44-year-old father of three children, is an inhabitant from Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To sustain his household, he cultivates rice with the support of his wife. It is the business that he has been with for six years, earning almost 25,000 KHR per day. Of the group of three, who are the second-time borrowers, Thhy is the leader. After the successful loan that has provided him with sufficient working capital to keep his business in a well manner, he feels so confident that he can upgrade his living conditions gradually. Now, the entire group, including him, is seeking 1,200,000 KHR each. For Thhy, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer for his rice farm. He hopes to double his yields so that he can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his rice farm

loans.name: Rina's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Rina is aged 25 years and married. She has one dependent son to take care of. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer for five years and sometimes her husband works for others for a fee to better feed their family. The current business earns her about 18,000 KHR per day and she manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Rina’s group consists of seven members who live in the same village and she has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles. Rina completely paid back the past loans, which have relieved her family’s financial burden. Now she is leading her group to request another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it for gasoline. Rina hopes to make healthy rice to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Tong's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Tong is 60 years old and married with ten children, three of whom are dependent on her and work as paid workers in the local area to earn additional income for the family. To support the family, Tong has been planting beans for 33 years, while her husband supplements the income by catching fish. From the current business, Tong can earn about 27,000 KHR per day and can save about 6,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is Tong's first cycle with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, while the other member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She is now leading her group of two to apply for a loan. Tong, who is the leader, will use her portion to pay for labor fees in plowing her rice fields. She hopes to get a high yield from the current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees in plowing her rice field

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en:
Khun is 52 years old and lives with her family in a rural village, in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married and has three children, two of whom are dependents and help in the family business. Rice farming and cultivation of chilies have been the main sources of her family’s income for twenty years. The current business earns her about 23,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. Drought is the main challenge for her farming business.
 
Khun’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. This is the first microloan for Khun with VisionFund. Khun is now leading her group to ask for a loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and fruitfully, so she can sell it for a good price to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Yak's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in a rural area of Tbaung Khmum district located in Kampong Cham province of Cambodia, Yak is a 32-year-old married woman with two dependent kids. Yak makes her living farming rice, and works for others as a paid worker. Yak’s husband also assists in the rice-farming business, and works an additional job as a motor-taxi driver in order to earn extra income for the family.

A first-time borrower, Yak is leading a female group member who also is a first-time borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, to take out a loan of 1,350,000 KHR in total. As group leader, Yak will use some portion of her loan to buy fertilizer to apply to her farmland, and use the other portion to fix her husband’s motor-taxi.

Her hope in the future, after receiving her loan portion and efficiently using it, is to run her business smoothly so that she can generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
Chreb, 45, is widow and a local farmer from Moung Russey district of Battambang Province. She has four children, two of whom are still in school; the remaining two help with the household chores, plus with the family's business. 

With her main business (that she has been with for 10 years), she is able to earn about 16,000 KHR per day. Chreb has been with VisionFund for one cycle, and fully paid back the loan which has better supported her business, and uplifted her living conditions. As a second-time borrower, she has formed a group of four members - the other three members are the first-time borrowers - to seek a new loan. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her cash-crop. She expects to enlarge her profit and carry on good progress of her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her cash-crop

loans.name: Romana

texts.es: La Sra. Romana tiene la edad de 62 años ella es casada desea contar con la ayuda de esta institución ella cuenta con una pequeña papelería llamada acuarela por tal motivo desea el crédito para invertir en mas mercancía para su papelería y así incrementar su numero de ventas.
texts.en: Romana is 62 years old and she is married. She wants the help of the field partner. She has a small stationery store called "acuarela" (watercolor). She wants to use the loan to invest in more merchandise for her stationery store in order to increase sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Phornyka's Group

texts.en:
A 43-year-old widow, Phornyka, resides in Pursat province’s Kror Kor district of Cambodia. She is a mother of two school-aged children; one is a seventh grader and the other one is an eighth grader. 

This single mother, Phornyka, supports her family by selling grocery items and raising pigs. She has been involved in these businesses for more than ten years. 

Phornyka has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for five loan cycles; with these, she has succeeded in meeting the food needs in her family.  Due to the lack of working capital to support her pig-raising business, Phornyka is leading a group of three to apply for a loan in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. As a group representative, Phornyka will utilize her loan portion to purchase feed for her pigs so that they will be fatter and healthier. 

She hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her family a good future through hard work on her business.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Originally from the Mongkul Borey district of Bateay Mean Chey province, Savun is a local farmer and her husband is a blacksmith. They are blessed with three children who currently are studying at the public school in the community. Engaging in this business for eight years, Savun is able to earn about 8 US dollars per day and saves about 5 US dollars per day. However, sometimes this income is quite lower than her expectations due to pests and weeds.

This is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She paid back her past loan completely, which supported her crops on time and kept all of her children in school. For this new cycle, she is seeking 1000 US dollars. She is going to use her loan to buy four sacks of fertilizer and pesticides. Moreover, she will use some portion of it to buy materials to support her husband's business. She hopes to minimize her loss and get back high margins to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of fertilizer and pesticides

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Phum's Group

texts.en:
Phum, a rural resident from Banteay Mean Chey province's Mongkul Borey district, is a mother of ten children. Her main source of income is rice farming, from which she is able to earn about 35,000 KHR per day. She has been engaged in this business for 25 years. Her main challenge is flooding, which has affected her cash-crop for three consecutive years and seriously reduced her yield, as well as her profit. 

Including this cycle, she is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund. Her past loan, which she completely paid back, has supported her in overcoming the losses during the flood and she could afford a decent standard of living. Now, she has formed a group of three to apply for a new loan -- the other two group members are second-time borrowers and they are applying for 500,000 KHR each. For Phum, she is seeking only 300,000 KHR based on her capacity.  As the leader, her loan portion will be used to purchase ten sacks of fertilizer for her rice field. She hopes to boost her crop production so she can earn more profit in order to maintain her household's condition.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of fertilizer for her rice field

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sothy

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Sothy is a 28-year-old mother of three dependent children.  Two of her children are in school, while the remaining one is too young for school. To support her children, Sothy has been farming rice for three years. Her husband has been buying and selling garbage in the local area, to supplement the income for the family. Insufficient working capital to buy fertilizer to apply to her rice paddy is the main challenge for Sothy's farming business.

Sothy received her first loan three cycles ago, and she completely repaid the loans to Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. With the loans from VisionFund, she has been able to better support her living. Now she is applying for another loan of $1,000 US. Sothy will use part of this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland, and part of it to spend on buying garbage to resell. She hopes to increase her family’s income, to raise their living standard and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and garbage for her husband's business of buying and reselling trash.

loans.name: Saran's Group

texts.en: A villager residing in Pursat province’s Kror Kor district of Cambodia, Saran is 28 years of age and married. She has four lovely dependent kids, all of whom are school-aged children. To earn a decent life for her family, Saran works as a rice farmer on one and a half hectare of farmland while her husband complements the income by working as a construction worker. Together, they earn approximately 23,500KHR per day. Saran is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Thanks to the previous loans, Saran was able to take care of the food need for her family. Now in hope of running a new business, Saran is leading a group of three members to take out a loan in the amount of 3,800,000KHR in total. As a group leader, Saran will use her  loan portion as working capital so that she has enough money needed to run her new business, which is a pig-raising business. She will use some portion of her loan to purchase pigs to raise and a portion to build a proper piggery in order to shelter them from the elements. Saran strongly hopes that her pig-raising business runs smoothly and provides greater income so that she can better support her beloved family.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise and to build piggery

loans.name: Lot's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Pursat province’s Bakan district, Lot is 40 years old and married with two dependent children who are still in school. To make a living, he has been farming rice on 1.5 hectares of farmland, while his wife raises ducks to earn additional income for the family. He can earn about 12,000 KHR per day from the current business and can save about 3,000 KHR each day for future needs. Low crop yields resulting from insects is the main challenge for his paddy business.

This is the first microloan for Lot’s group of three with VisionFund. He is now leading his group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. He wants to use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland and use a portion of it to buy ducks for raising. Lot hopes to increase his crop yields and also hopes to fatten his ducks to sell them for a good price to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farmland and purchase ducks for raising

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en: Due to hardships of living, Eleonor runs a small eatery in their community. She is 41 years old and has four school-age children. She aimed to improve her business to generate sufficient income to help her husband in financing the education of their children. Despite problems and difficulties in life, she has the determination to pursue the business. She planned to sell different grocery items and cook more recipes to satisfy her customers' demand. Due to financial difficulties, she is asking for an additional capital of P10,000.00 to buy grocery items, soft drinks, meat, vegetables and ingredients needed in preparing the recipes. Through her patience and hard work, she believes that she can make the business grow and be a profitable source of income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, soft drinks, meat, vegetables and ingredients needed in preparing the recipes

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Nov is aged 42 years and married. She has two children, both of whom are dependents and have their own employment. To support the family, Nov has been farming rice for nineteen years, while her husband complements the income by working as a motor-taxi driver in the local area. The current business earns her family about US$6 per day to meet her family’s needs. Insufficient working capital is the main challenge for her paddy business. 

Nov has been with VisionFund for one cycle and successfully paid back the past loan, which helped her relieve her family’s burden. Now requesting another loan with VisionFund for US$200, Nov will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice in a timely manner and successfully so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Chunla's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Chunla is now 29 years old and married. She has three children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. Cassava planting is the main business for Chunla to support her family. Having been in the business for nineteen years, she is able to make daily earnings of 21,000 KHR and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day. 

This is the first loan for Chunla with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of four members to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava planting. Through this loan, she hopes to get a high crop yield from her cassava plantation so as to sell it for a good price to better her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava plantation

loans.name: Srey Ya's Group

texts.en:
Srey Ya is 36 years old and lives in a rural area of Kror Kor district, located in Pursat province of Cambodia. She is married and blessed with two lovely daughters, both of whom are dependent on her. To meet the family’s needs, Srey Ya and her husband work for others as paid workers. Together, they earn approximately 16,500 KHR per day. Srey Ya has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles already, with which she succeeded in securing food needed for her family. 

Now Srey Ya would like to bring out the entrepreneurial side of herself, by requesting a new loan in order to buy a plot of farmland, so that she can operate her own rice-growing business. Srey Ya’s group consists of two women; both of them are fourth-time borrowers with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. As a group representative, Srey Ya is leading her group to request a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 KHR in total. Her biggest expectation for the future is to be able to increase her family’s income, so that the living standard of her family will improve gradually.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn dreams that someday, she will become financially stable and her children will have a bright future. She is 33 years old and has three school-age children. Despite being a widowed, she has the strong determination to uplift their status of living. She runs a small variety store in their community to generate income. She aims to improve and strengthen her business to earn a higher income. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional P10,000 to buy canned goods, breads, snack foods, noodles, soaps, candies, beverages and soft drinks for sale. She is hoping that this financial assistance will help her to make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads, snack foods, noodles, soaps, candies, beverages and soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo is now 49 years old and has five grown-up children. They live in a village planting rice, vegetables, and raising livestock for sale. Since it is their main source of income, Eduardo aims to improve his farming business to increase his production and income to satisfy his family's needs and support the education of his children. Despite the hardships of living, he wants to continue sending his children to school so that they will earn degrees and find good jobs someday. In this regard, Eduardo plans to expand his rice plantation to ensure a high production. He is asking for an additional capital of PHP 50,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pay for expenses incurred in land preparation and transplanting of rice seedlings. He hopes that someday, he will improve his farming business and educate all his children, for he believes that, “If there is patience, there is progress.”

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pay for expenses incurred in land preparation and transplanting of rice seedlings

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Leonard is 32 years old, married, and has one infant-aged child. He aims to uplift their status of living so that he can give his family a better life. The main source of their living is through farming, but aside from it, he also engages in buying and selling charcoal within their community to generate additional income. He aims to strengthen this business and make it profitable, but due to insufficient capital, he is asking for an additional PHP 10,000 to buy additional stock of charcoals to sell in the community. He believes that this loan will make it possible to improve the business and he hopes that someday, he will make the business a viable and profitable source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en: Gliceria is a responsible housewife who helps her husband in generating income. She is 48 years old and has three school-aged children. She is running a variety store in their village, selling different grocery items, fruits, and vegetables. She has been operating the business for almost 20 years now. Most of her income is used to pay for food, clothing, and allowances of her children in school. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Gliceria aims to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demands. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy grocery items, soft drinks, fruits, and vegetables to sell in the community. She believes that this loan will enable her to improve the business and she is hoping that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, soft drinks, fruits, and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en: Rodolfo is a hard-working father who is engaged in selling AVON, Natasha and Boardwalk products in their community to generate additional income. He is 31 years old and has two infant children. He and his wife aim to earn and save more income to satisfy their necessities and save for the future of their children. While he takes care of their two kids, he finds time to sell the said products in the village while his wife is working in a private company. He aims to acquire more of the said products to sell but he does not have enough capital.  Therefore, he is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy AVON, Natasha and Boardwalk products to sell. Being kind and friendly to others, Rodolfo believes that he can sell more of his products and make the business a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy AVON, Natasha and Boardwalk products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Tuao South, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcayaa

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Originally from Thmor Koul district of Battambang Province, Khen is a 38-year-old married woman.  She has four kids who are in school. She raises pigs. She has had that job for 10 years, and it supports her family as the main source of income. To better feed the household; her husband also works for others for a fee. From current businesses, they are able to earn about KHR 34,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. Low crop yield resulting from flood is her main challenge for her farming business.  

Khen has been with VisionFund for five times and successfully repaid all her loans. The past loans have helped her to support her family with enough food. Now she is applying for a loan of KHR 2,000,000. Khen will use her loan to buy pig feeds for her pig business and use a portion of it to spend on renovating her old house. She hopes to fatten her pig in order to sell it for a good price so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy pig feeds for her pig business

loans.name: Jin's Group

texts.en:
Jin is a citizen residing in a rural area of Tbaung Khmum district located in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She is 55 years old and married with four children. Jin and her husband farm rice and plant cassava. They have been doing this for more than 20 years in order to support the family’s finances.

Jin, a first-time borrower with VisionFund, is leading a group member who also is a first-time borrower with VisionFund to take out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000KHR each. As a group leader, Jin will use her very first requested loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor fees. Her biggest hope is to be able to harvest good quality crop yields so that she can sell them at good prices.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Chansok

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Chansok is a 49-year-old, widowed mother of eight children. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for two years.  In addition, to better support the family and earn more income, she raises pigs and sells groceries. Chansok can earn about 25,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs and can manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day for future needs. Lack of working capital to support her current businesses is her main challenge.

Chansok is a first-time borrower with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 610,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy groceries to resell. Chansok hopes this loan will enable her to make more income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy groceries to resell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is mother who runs a small variety store in her village. She aims to improve her business and increase her income to satisfy her family's necessities and finance the education of her two children. She and her husband aim to uplift their status of living to give their children a better life. Despite problems and difficulties in life, they have the determination improve their business. Tessie is asking for an additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits, candies, junk foods, beverages, noodles, soaps, seasonings, and soft drinks to sell. She believes that someday she will make the business grow and improve their status of living as they continue to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy various items to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Sichan's Group

texts.en: Residing in a rural area of Thmor Koul district located in Battambang province of Cambodia, Sichan is 56 years of age and married with five children. She makes her living by farming rice on a two-hectare farmland, earning around 15,000 KHR per day. Sichan has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four loan cycles already, with which she succeeded in improving her day-to-day livelihood. She is leading a group of two members to request a loan in the amount of 700,000 KHR in total. Sichan, with her loan portion, will spend it on buying fertilizer to support her farmland. After receiving her loan portion and wisely using it, Sichan believes that her rice field will provide good quality crop yields so that she can earn more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Las Comadres  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Las Comadres es un banco comunal que está formado por 7 amigas, algunas de las socias formaban parte de otros bancos comunales y ahora se han reunido para formar parte de este nuevo banco comunal, viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente aún conservan la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Las socias son mujeres que luchan día a día para mejorar su economía y salir adelante con sus familias, son mujeres con mucho sentido del humor a pesar de las adversidades, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Melba, vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos, uno de sus hijos es casado y vive  independiente, otro hijo trabaja y  le ayuda economícamente y su ultima hija de apenas 6 años de edad se encuentra estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo no se encuentra en el país ya que ha migrado en busca de un mejor futuro para su familia, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Melba trabaja en la elaboración de edredones, esta actividad la aprendió trabajando y ahora tiene el negocio de venta de edredones desde hace 6 años, vende ambulantemente su mercadería, también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de varias marcas, en casa  desde hace 15 años se dedica a la cría y  venta de pollos.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de edredones y cosméticos para continuar con este negocio.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
"Las Comadres" is a communal bank that consists of seven friends. Some of the members were part of other communal banks and now they have come together to be part of this new communal bank. They live in different places of the city of Cuenca. This city is surrounded by four rivers, its architecture is a mix of colonial and modern, and its people still preserve the culture and traditions of their village. 

The members are women who struggle every day to improve their economies and get ahead with their families. They are women with good sense of humor despite the adversities. They still maintain the culture and traditions of their people. 

One of the members of this group is Melba, who lives in Totoracocha sector, in the city of Cuenca. She is 41 years old, is married and in her marriage she conceived three children. One of her sons is married and lives independently, another son works and helps her economically, and her youngest daughter who is barely six years old is studying in a school in the city. Her husband is not in the country, he has migrated in search of a better future for his family. She doesn't own a house, so she is renting one.  

Melba works making quilts. She learned this activity working, and now she has a business selling quilts for six years. She sells the merchandise as a street peddler. She also sells several brands of cosmetics. At home, she has been raising and selling chickens for 15 years.

Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of quilts and cosmtics, to continue with this business. Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy quilts and cosmetics.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is a 56-year-old married woman with four children living in Tbaung Khmum district located in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. Touch and her husband farm rice and plant cassava in order to make a living. Together, they earn around 20,000KHR per day. 

Touch’s group consists of two members who all are first-time borrowers with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. As a group representative, Touch is leading her group to request a loan in the amount of 2,000,000KHR in total. 

Touch will use her loan portion to purchase fertilizer and to pay for labor fees. She highly hopes that, after receiving her requested loan portion and using it as she plans, her business will provide her with more income so that she is able to better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay for labor fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Chem's Group

texts.en:
Sixty-year-old Chem is a villager living in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district of Cambodia. He is a single father of five children, one (a son) of whom is under his responsibility and is currently in school. Chem has been working as a construction worker for ten years, earning around 12,500 KHR per day and saving approximately 6,000 KHR after deducting his daily expenses. 

He is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan that he received helped relieve the burden of his family and keep his dependent child in school. Now he is leading a group member, named Hourt, to apply for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KHR and 200,000 KHR respectively. Chem will use his loan portion to buy study materials and school uniforms for his school-aged child. This hardworking and heartwarming father has always placed his focus on his children. His only hope is to be able to provide his child with enough study materials (books, pencils, and bag) and proper school uniforms to wear.

loans.use: to buy study materials and school uniforms for his school-aged child

loans.name: Munaza

texts.en:
Munaza is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last ten years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. 

Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is a mother of four children. She is motivated to provide support to her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing customer demand consistently. She is in her first loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla, 25, is living in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham Province. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Phalla has been farming for seven years on two hectares of farmland as her main source of income. Phalla also plants cassava to earn additional income to support her family. The current business earns her about 7US$ per day and she manages to save about 3US$ each day after offsetting daily expenses.  

Phalla has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and completely repaid the past loan, which has improved her living conditions so her family is better than before. Now she is requesting another loan of 1,000US$. She wants to use this loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her plantation and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. Phalla hopes to earn more income from her current businesses so she can save some money to buy a new motorbike for her family to use and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her plantation, and pay for labor fees

loans.name: Keng's Group

texts.en:
Keng, 53, lives in one of the remote areas of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. She has five children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming as their main source of income. To better feed the family, they also raise pigs and make palm juice. They have been with this business for thirty years, and Keng is able to save only 10,000KHR per day for the family needs. 
This is the first loan for Keng with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group of three to request a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on renovating her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high yield from her paddy-field and also hopes to get a proper house for living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Moibatou

texts.fr: Agée de 38ans, Moibatou est mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 15ans et 04ans. Elle vend des mèches et des tissages depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Dans le but de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement à Finadev en vue d'accroître son revenu supplémentaire et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Moibatou, 38 years old, is married and has three children in school. The eldest is 15 years old and the youngest is four. She has been selling hair extensions and hair weaves for some years. She stocks up at one of Benin markets and out of the country. With the goal of bolstering her working capital and meeting customer demand, she has requested and obtained financing from Finadev, so as to increase her additional income and help provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy 75 packs of hair extensions and 75 packs of hair weaves.

loans.name: Choen

texts.en:
Choen is a 62-year-old resident from the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. She is married and has seven children. She farms rice and sells grocery items in the local area. Additionally, her husband makes palm juice for extra income. She and her husband have been in these businesses for 37 years, and are able to earn about 11,000 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Choen with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy materials for making palm juice, such as large pans and bamboo containers. She hopes this loan will enable them to earn more income from the palm juice business, so as to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials for making palm juice

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika, de 37 años, es una mujer amable, alegre y muy trabajadora, está casada con Héctor y junto al él tiene un pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad, construyó su casa propia apoyando a su esposo y es ahí donde comparte sus días junto a su familia quienes la impulsan siempre a seguir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo de Erika consiste en la venta diaria de gaseosas de todas las marcas, tamaños y sabores, prepara helados de agradable sabor y hielos que ayudan a refrescar el paladar de las personas que acuden a su vivienda a comprarle algo de lo que ofrece. Acondicionó un pequeño espacio en su casa en donde ha instalado su refrigeradora y las cajas de gaseosas que ofrece a la venta. Lleva en este negocio 2 años y le va bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la rentabilidad económica que percibe lo cual le sirve para cubrir los gastos diarios básicos de su hogar, al principio le fue complicado porque no tenía donde congelar sus bebidas, afortunadamente pudo comprar su propia refrigeradora y superó el percance, ahora todo marcha de maravilla y sus planes de crecimiento continúan en camino. Este es el préstamo número 1 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este crédito para continuar con el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 600 soles, comprará gaseosas, bolsas, y todos los ingredientes necesarios que usa en la preparación de helados de frutas frescas, azúcar y otros insumos.
texts.en:
Erika, age 37, is a kind, happy, and hard-working woman.  She is married to Héctor, and they have a small two year old child.  She helped her husband build their own house.  That is where she shares her days with her family.  They are her driving force to always get ahead and improve her quality of life.

Every day Erika sells all brands, sizes, and flavors of soft drinks.  She makes tasty ice creams and ices.  They help refresh the palates of the people who come to her house to buy something that she sells.

She fixed up a small space in her house where she has put her refrigerator and the cases of soft drinks that she sells.  She has been in this business for two years, and it is going well for her.  The thing she likes about her business is that it is profitable.  This serves to cover the daily, basic household expenses.
