In the beginning it was difficult for her because she did not have a place to keep her drinks cold.  Fortunately, she was able to buy her own refrigerator, and she overcame the problem.  Now, everything is going wonderfully.  Her plans for growth continue on track.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is grateful to those who make it possible for her to have this loan so that she can continue achieving her objectives.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  Also, it pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.

She will use the requested 600 soles to buy soft drinks, bags, and all of the ingredients needed, like fresh fruit, sugar, and other supplies, to make ice cream.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bags, and all of the ingredients to make ice cream.

loans.name: Rosario Elizabeth

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario Elizabeth tiene la edad de 25 años  en esta ocasión desea el crédito para la compra de mercancía ella se encuentra separada tiene un negocio de ropa a fuera de su hogar ella ya contaba anteriormente con crédito en esta institución y llevo muy  buen crédito espera en esta ocasión contar de nuevo con la ayuda de kiva.
texts.en: Rosario Elizabeth is 25 years old. At this time she wants the loan to purchase merchandise. She is separated. She has a clothing business out of her house. Previously she counted on a loan with this institution and she has very good credit. She hopes in this moment to count again on the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Choern's Group

texts.en:
Choern is age 30 and married. She lives in a rural area in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has one son, who is too young for school. Choern has been involved in farming to earn a living for ten years. Her husband supplements the family's income by catching fish. The current businesses earn them about 47,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs, and she can manage to save about 20,000 KHR per day. Lack of working capital is the main challenge for their current businesses.

Choern’s group consists of four members who live in the same village. This is the first loan for Choern with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to request a loan. Choern, the group leader, will use her portion of the loan to buy a boat and other fishing equipment for her husband’s fishing business. She hopes he will catch more fish to sell, which would improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a boat and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny is 53 years old, and she has one daughter. She is a villager from a rural area located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has earned a living through selling grocery items in her local area for 19 years. Ny earns approximately 15,400 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day from the current business, but she can manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.

Ny’s group consists of two members who are all first loan-cycle clients with VisionFund. She and her group member are asking for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR and 200,000 KHR respectively. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items for selling such as sugar, salt, water and eggs, etc. Ny hopes to increase her income from the current business so as to better her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase stock of sugar, flour, cooking fat, etc., and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 56 years old and from the village of Puti, Zestaponi district. He lives with his 47-year-old wife, his mother-in-law, and three grown children. His mother-in-law gets a retirement pension. Gocha works as a builder and has a rich experience in this field. In addition, the family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows, produce cheese and sell it locally. Gocha also owns a 0.75 hectare vineyard, and all members of the family work hard to ensure a good harvest.

Gocha requested a loan to purchase a tractor. It will be an additional source of family income. In the village where Gocha lives, people don’t have their own tractors to cultivate their lands. Accordingly, Gocha will serve them with his tractor and get service fees from local people. It will significantly increase the profit of the family and they will improve their living conditions. Gocha awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor.

loans.name: Mindia

texts.en:
Mindia is from Kareli district of East Georgia. He is 37 years old, married and a father of four children. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. In particular, they run a small dairy farm of six calves and two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. Besides this, Mindia owns 0.8 hectare of agricultural land, where potatoes, haricots and nuts are grown. 

He does all the relevant agricultural works to ensure a good harvest. The harvested products, as well as cheese, are sold at the local open market. Mindia works hard to make some savings and improve the living conditions for his family.

He requested a loan to purchase calves. Mindia will raise them and, after several months, the family will be able to receive more milk. This will give them an opportunity to produce more cheese and increase sales. Mindia will use the received profit for financing the education of his children and improving the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is from the village of Ruisi, of Kareli district. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and mother-in-law, who is a pensioner. Lali is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, the family grows onions and cabbages on the family-owned land, and they do all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. Besides that, Lali runs a small dairy farm of a calf and two milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy products. She sells her dairy products and harvested vegetables at the local open market. Lali works hard to do her best for her family.

She requested a loan for harvesting cabbages (paying the workforce and transportation). The harvested cabbages will be sold, and this will significantly increase the family income. With the increased income, Lali will improve the living conditions for the family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to cover the costs of harvesting the cabbage crop.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina de 58 años, es viuda. Logró con esfuerzo sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos hoy ya mayores e independientes, pero vive al lado de su nieto en una casa de adobe de su propiedad. Desde hace mas de 20 años, Guillermina es una conocida señora dedicada al rubro de la producción de cacao en su zona, liderando sola el negocio, pero con asesoría de sus hijos contrata personal para la siembra, mantenimiento y cosecha del mismo. A ella le agrada mucho liderar todo el proceso, pues a pesar de su edad siente que es capaz de hacer muchas cosas aún. Actualmente, tiene una buena oferta por parte de un centro de acopio que esta apostando en un precio considerable para los productores de su zona y es necesario iniciar con la preparación del terreno para tener las plantaciones de cacao, listas y prestas para lo cual esta duplicando la cantidad de jornaleros que laboraran en la zona, como también realizar el pedido de los sacos de abono orgánico lo mas pronto posible. Este es su crédito número 16, muy agradecida y con una sonrisa manifiesta que su constancia se debe a que le va muy bien con MFP al igual que con su banco comunal donde tiene compañeros que saben escuchar y ve en ellos buenas ideas. Con los 2,000 soles, podrá dar de anticipado el costo a los vendedores de abono orgánico al igual que el pago a los jornaleros, quienes se dedicaran a sacar la yerba mala.
texts.en:
58-year-old Guillermina is a widow.  With much effort she has managed to support and raise her two children who today are grown and independent.  She lives with her grandson in an adobe house that belongs to her.  For more than 20 years, Guillermina has been a well-known woman making a living in the field of cocoa production in her area.  She leads the business on her own, but at the advice of her children she hires workers for the planting, maintenance, and harvesting of the cocoa.  It pleases her very much to lead the whole process because despite her age she feels that she is still capable of doing many things.  

Right now she has a good offer on behalf of a storage center that is paying a considerable price for the products in her area and it is necessary to begin preparation of the land in order to have the plantations of cocoa ready and prepared, for which the number of seasonal laborers that work in the area is doubling and why she is also placing the order for the sacks of organic fertilizer as soon as possible.  

This is her 16th loan.  She is very grateful, and with a smile she says that her perseverance is due to the fact that it is going very well with MFP, as well as with her communal bank where she has friends who know how to listen and in whom she sees good ideas.  With the 2,000 soles she will be able to pay the cost in advance to the vendors of the organic fertilizer, and do the same with paying the laborers who will work to get rid of the bad weeds.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and hire laborers.

loans.name: Jacqueline's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Jacqueline la responsable est âgée de 41ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont trois sont scolarisés. L'aîné a 18ans et le benjamin a 03ans. Elle a un cafétariat où elle vend de divers puis prépare et vend de la nourriture depuis 03ans. Elle fait ses approvisionnements dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci d'augmenter son capital et de couvrir les attentes de ses clients, elle a fait recours au micro crédit de finadev. Le bénéfice généré par ce micro crédit lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et d'acquérir une parcelle.
texts.en: This is a group of two individuals taking out a solidarity loan. Jacqueline, 41 years old, is the group’s leader. She is married and the mother of four children, three of whom are in school. The eldest in 18 years old and the youngest is three. She has a café in which she has been selling miscellaneous items and cooked dishes for three years. She stocks up at one of the markets in Benin. With the goal of bolstering her  working capital and meeting customers’ expectations, she has taken advantage of a Finadev microloan. This revenues generated thanks to this microloan will allow her to help pay for her children’s schooling and to purchase a land plot.

loans.use: to buy 1/4 box of milk, 1/2 box of spaghetti, 1/2 box of sardines, 1/2 box of cafe, 1/4 box of sugar and one box of couscous.

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es: Giovana, de 39 años, es una mujer muy alegre, entusiasta y muy trabajadora, convive con Felipe desde hace muchos años y tiene 3 hijos de 24, 18 y 15 años de edad respectivamente. Junto a todos ellos vive en su casa propia que construyó al lado de su pareja gracias al empeño que cada uno pone en su trabajo. El trabajo de Giovana se inicia muy temprano sale al taller que alquila en un local cerca al centro de la ciudad, ya que ella es socia de un negocio en el que se dedican a confeccionar y refaccionar diferentes prendas de vestir ya sea de damas, caballeros y niños. Plasma en cada uno de las prendas que realiza lo mejor de su creatividad poniendo mucho empeño en la ejecución de los detalles, todo ese perfeccionismo se refleja en la satisfacción que muestran sus clientes al recibir una prenda de calidad. Lleva en este negocio mas de 4 años, en ocasiones trabaja en su casa en donde también tiene una modesta maquina de coser y todos los materiales necesarios para cumplir su labor. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que labora al lado de persona con experiencia que le ayudan a ser mejor cada día tanto laboral como emocionalmente, además, asegura que sus clientes son selectos y eso le permite recibir buenos pagos por cada prenda que realiza, espera seguir progresando en esta actividad ya que tiene muchas expectativas a futuro. Este es el préstamo número 3 con MFP, agradece a aquellas personas que le brindan el crédito que requiere para aumentar su capital de trabajo, se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que son muy solidarios y responsables. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, ella comprará colgadores de ropa, hilos de colores, agujas y algunas telas especiales para confeccionar vestidos y blusas.
texts.en:
Giovana, 39, is a very happy, enthusiastic, and hardworking woman.  She has lived with Felipe for many years and has three children, ages 24, 18, and 15.  They live together in their own house, which she and her partner built thanks to the effort they both put into their jobs.

Giovana starts working very early, leaving for the shop she rents near downtown.  She's a member of a business in which they make and mend a variety of garments for women, men, and children.  In each one of the garments, she captures the best of her creativity, making an effort in the details.  All this perfectionism is reflected in her customers' satisfaction when they get a quality garment.

She has been in this business for more than four years.  Sometimes she works at home, where she also has a modest sewing machine and all the materials she needs to do her work.

What she likes about this job is that she works alongside experienced people who help her be better every day, both at work and emotionally.  Also, she's certain that her customers are exclusive, and this allows her to receive good pay for each garment she makes.  She hopes to continue making progress in this work because she has many expectations for the future.

This is her third loan with MFP.  She's grateful to those people who gave her the loan she needs to increase her working capital.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  She's happy to belong to her communal bank because they're very supportive and responsible.

With the requested amount of 1500 soles [PEN] she'll buy clothes hangers, colored thread, needles, and some special fabrics to make dresses and blouses.

loans.use: to buy hangers, thread, needles, and fabric to make dresses and blouses

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Kror Kor district of Cambodia, Ren is 41 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. To make a living and take care of her children, she is a grocery seller, while her husband farms rice. They have been in these businesses for ten years. From the current businesses, she and her husband can earn about 20,000 KHR per day, and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after paying for living expenses. The main challenge for her rice business is drought.

This is the first microloan for Ren’s group with VisionFund. Ren is leading the group of five members to apply for a loan. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. Ren hopes this loan will enable her and her husband to grow rice healthily and timely, so as to sell it for a good price and fulfill her dream to expand the current businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap, age 35, lives in a wooden house in a village in the Sampov Meas District. She is married and the mother of three children, all of whom are still in school. To support the family, she has been engaged in farming on 2.5 hectares of farmland. To add more income, she also buys rice to resell in her local area. Having been in this business for almost ten years, she is able to earn about $12 US per day and manages to save approximately $6 US each day after daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her farming business.   

Sopheap has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for one loan cycle, and she completely paid back the loan. After this loan, she feels confident that she will make her life better. Now she is applying for another loan of $1,000 US. With this loan, Sopheap wants to buy a decent motor. This loan will enable her to have a proper motor for commuting in her family. She hopes to make a better life and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy a decent motor

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 38 años, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora, es madre de 2 hijos cuyas edades son 20y 13 años, está casada con Alvenis y vive junto a toda su familia en su casa propia que construyó con los ahorros que juntaron de su trabajo.  El trabajo de Ana consiste en brindar servicio de conversor de gas. Su función se basa en sustituir el uso tradicional del combustible que usan la mayoría de carros y mototaxis en la ciudad por el empleo ecológico del gas natural. Para cumplir esta labor necesita ciertos equipos o implementos que compra por paquetes dependiendo del sistema vehicular y del gusto del clientes ya sea para vehículos antiguos o modernos en lo cuales se emplean equipos mas sofisticados de instalación. Aprendió esta labor con su esposo cuando trabajaban en un proyecto de gas, ahora ellos se dedican a esta actividad desde hace 6 años y tienen su propio local. Trabaja con la ayuda de un técnico automotriz y 2 obreros más. Adicionalmente vende diferentes repuestos y accesorios, sin embargo también esta instalando un lavadero de vehículos lo cual ha sabido complementar muy bien ya que su objetivo es brindar un servicio completo y de calidad. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la rentabilidad que su trabajo le genera por la demanda continua que existe en su rubro, lo que ahora tiene planeado es consolidar los servicios que brinda y unificarlos como un excelente paquete automotriz. Este es el préstamo número 4 con MFP, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual y continuar trabajando con mucha responsabilidad junto a los miembros de su banco comunal. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles comprará dos paquetes de conversión de gas de tercera generación para cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana, 38 years old, is a happy and hardworking woman. She is the mother of two children, ages 13 and 20, and her husband's name is Alvenis. She lives with her family in their own house, which was built with their combined savings from work. 

Ana's work consists of offering gas conversion services. This is based on substituting the use of traditional gas, which the majority of cars and taxis use, for the eco-friendly use of natural gas. To carry out this work, she needs certain equipment and tools which she buys in kits, depending on the vehicular system and on the preference of the clients. She works with both old and new cars, in which more sophisticated equipment is used. 

She learned about this type of work with her husband when they were working on a gas project. They have been making a living in this line of work for six years, and they now have their own workshop. She works with the help of an automotive technician and two other workers. Additionally, she sells various spare parts and accessories. She is also installing a car wash, which she knows will complement her business because her goal is to offer a complete, high quality service. 

What she likes about her job is the profits which the work generates, due to the continued demand in the market. What she plans to do now is to consolidate the services which she offers and unify them into an excellent automotive package.

This is her fourth loan with MPF. She is very grateful for the opportunity for the loans which they offer her and for the financial backing which she needs to continue with her business. She is committed to paying her monthly dues on time and to continue working in a responsible manner, along with the members of the communal bank. With the amount she has applied for, 1500 soles, she will buy two third-generation fuel conversion kits to fulfill the orders of her clients.

loans.use: to buy two third-generation fuel conversion kits to fulfill the orders of her clients.

loans.name: Senghun

texts.en:
Senghun is 31 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Bakan district of Pursat province. She has five dependent children to take care of and now they are in school in the local area. Rice farming is the only primary source of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for several years. Senghun can save approximately about 10,000 KHR each day for her future needs. 

This is the first micro loan for Senghun with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 KHR. She wants to use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and start a new business as a grocery seller to earn additional income to better support the family. Senghun hopes to increase her current business to earn a more income to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and start a new grocery store business

loans.name: Santos Matías

texts.es:
Santos tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. desde que tenia 10 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, fue su padre quien le enseño. èl le decia que no debia conformarse con saber de un solo trabajo sino que de varios; por tal motivo don Santos tambien tiene conocimientos de carpinteria, elaborando camas, mesas, sillas, jugueteras, camas de carretas, ejes, entre otos màs. Tambien trabaja en estructuras metalicas, afila cumas, machetes, hachas. ademas, se dedica al destazo de cerdos y reses, èl manifiesta que de todo le enseño hacer su padre, para que pudiera defenderse en la vida y hoy en dìa se lo agradece mucho. 

Los insumos que necesita para realizar sus diferentes ocupaciones, las adquiere en la ciudad. Debido a que en el lugar en donde vive solo hay un autobus, èl debe salir temprano de su casa, ya que si se queda debe caminar a pie durante una hora hasta la carretera.

El prèstamo que esta solicitando a Fundaciòn Campo, es para comprar dos sacos de abono, una sepilladora y una sierra de mano. Con la iversiòn podra abonar su cultivo a tiempo para obtener buenos frutos y dispondra de dos herramientas que tanto necesita para su trabajo. 

Su gran sueño, es trabajar muy fuerte para ahorrar  y construir una casa para sus hijos, ya que en donde viven es casa de un hermano. Ademàs desea brindar la educaciòn a sus hijos ya que por la pobreza en que su familia vivia Santos solo aprendio a leer; màs sin embargo agradece a su padre por todo su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Santos, 36, is married and has three children. Since he was 10 years old, he has been farming, an occupation his father taught him. He father decided, though, that Santos should learn more than one profession, and now Santos has carpentry skills and makes beds, chairs, toys, children´s beds, axles, and more. He also makes metal structures; sharpens knives, machetes, and axes; and butchers pigs and cattle. Santos says his father taught him everything that was necessary to make your way in life, and he is very grateful to him.

He buys his supplies in the city. Since there is just one bus that serves his area, he must leave his house very early because he has more than an hour´s walk to the highway. He is applying for this loan to Fundaciòn Campo to buy sacks of manure, a planer, and a hand saw. With the investment, he will be able to fertilize his crops on time to yield a good harvest. He will also have use of two tools he needs for his work.

His greatest dream is to work hard to save and build a home for his sons, as they are now living at his brother´s house. He also wants to give his sons a good education. Santos´s family lived in such poverty that he only learned to read; yet, he thanks his father for all his efforts.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure, a planer, and a hand saw.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey is 47 years of age and lives in Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She is married and blessed with four children, one of whom is under her responsibility and currently in school. 

Srey and her husband support their family by working as rice farmers. Having been in this business for more than 10 years, together they are able to earn around 26,500 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day and save approximately 9,500 KHR for future needs after deducting the daily cost of living. 

Srey is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She comments that the previous loan that she successfully paid back made her life so much better. 

Now, she is leading a group of three female members to take out a loan in the amount of 2,100,000 KHR in total. With 500,000 KHR, the loan portion of Srey will be spent on buying fertilizer to keep her rice field in good shape. Via the help of this loan portion, Srey strongly believes that her rice field will provide a good quality crop yield so that she can boost her income as well as improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to keep her rice field in good shape.

loans.name: Thenn

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Thenn is 29 years old and married. She has two children who are dependents and too young for school. To support the family, she and her husband have been in farming and working as a paid construction worker in local area for 10 years. The current business earns her family about 40,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. Lacking a water supply to apply to her paddy field is the main challenge.
   
Thenn is a first-time client with VisionFund. She is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizer for her farmland and piglets to raise to earn additional income for the family. She hopes to grow her current business as well as earn more income for the family to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and piglets

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap, 42, lives in a rural village in Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district, Cambodia. She is married and has six children, all of whom are dependents. Some of her children are in school and some help in the family’s business. For the last four years, Pheap has been farming and buying rice to sell while her husband works as a solider in the local area to better support the family. Pheap can earn about KHR 34,000 per day to respond to her family’s needs and manages to save about KHR 20,000 each day for her future needs. Drought is the main challenge for her paddy field business.

Pheap is a first-time borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group of four to request a loan. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy rice to resell. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income for the family to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy rice to sell

loans.name: Victor Guadalupe

texts.es: El Sr. víctor Guadalupe tiene la edad de 44 años el es empleado de mostrador de la compañía Racing autoparts tiene 10 años de antigüedad en ese trabajo en esta ocasión desea el crédito de su vivienda para finalizar algunos detalles que tiene su casa por el exterior desea contar con el apoyo de kiva.
texts.en: Victor Guadalupe is 44 years old and is a counter employee at the Racing Auto Parts company. He has 10 years of seniority in this job. This time, he wants a loan for his home, to finish some details in the exterior of his house. He hopes to have the support of Kiva.

loans.use: to finish the exterior of his home.

loans.name: Grupo Nuevo Almaguer Group

texts.es: El Grupo Nuevo Almaguer se encuentra ya en su cuarto ciclo de crédito, el grupo celebra sus reuniones al oriente de la ciudad de Monterrey. Las integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades diversas como venta de comidas, venta de productos naturales, venta de ropa usada en los mercados rodantes y venta de tamales. Doña Eluteria es una de las integrantes del grupo, tiene 61 años, es casada, con 2 hijos ya casados. Eluteria se dedica a la venta de tamales (un platillo típico de la comida mexicana) los fines de semana con sus vecinos de la colonia y vende también productos naturales de uso personal como jugos con vitamitnas, cremas naturales y malteadas. La señora Eluteria comenzó con la venta de tamales hace 10 años porque su esposo se enfermó y ella tuvo que salir adelante por su cuenta. Con su crédito, Eluteria quiere comprar suficientes insumos para elaborar sus tamales y así estar preparada para las ventas navideñas que son las mejores del año para este platillo acá en México. El sueño de Eluteria es tener un establecimiento para la venta de sus tamales, ya que el local le favorecerá en el incremento de sus ventas y podrá dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nuevo Almaguer is in its fourth loan cycle. The group meets in the eastern section of the city of Monterrey. The members pursue different activities: selling food, natural products, tamales, and used clothing in the nearby markets. Eluteria, 61, is one of the members and is married with two married children. Eluteria sells tamales, a traditional Mexican dish, on weekends with her neighbors. She also sells personal natural products such as juices with vitamins, natural creams, and malts. She started selling tamales 10 years ago when her husband became ill and she had to work on his behalf.

With this loan, Eluteria wants to buy enough supplies to make tamales and be ready for the Christmas season, the best part of the year for selling this Mexican dish. She dreams of having her own place to sell tamales since the stall would help her increase sales and better serve her customers.

loans.use: to stock merchandise for the winter season.

loans.name: Sobotra's Group

texts.en:
Sobotra, 31,  is single and lives in a rural area located in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. He has earned a living through farming rice for 10 years and working as a paid construction worker in the local area for five years. Sobotra can earn about KHR 22,000 per day from the current business and is able to save about KHR 10,000 each day for the future. 

This is the fourth loan for Sobotra with VisionFund and he has fully paid back his prior loans. He used the first loan wisely and successfully to improve his standard of living. Now he is leading his group of four to request a new loan to buy fertilizers for his farmland and to buy a decent motor for commuting. He hopes to get a high yield from the current crop to sell at a good price and fulfill his dream of buying cows to raise.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Kheoun's Group

texts.en: Kheoun, 33, is a resident of a rural area of Moung Russey district located in Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married and has three kids, some of whom are school-aged children and some are too young to attend school. To provide a decent life for the family, Kheoun and her husband work two jobs each (rice farmer and paid worker). Together, they earn around 14,500 KHR per day. Kheoun is a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is very satisfied that she was able to improve the living standard of her family through the help that she already received in the form of previous loans. Now she is leading a group of four female members who are applying for a new loan with VisionFund. With her requested loan portion, Kheoun will buy fertilizer and pesticide in order to keep her rice field in good shape. This hard-working woman expects to see a higher crop yield in her business as well as a boost in her income after receiving her loan portion and applying it as she has planned.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 43 años, es un hombre honesto, trabajador y sobre todo muy responsable, esta casado y vive junto a su esposa en una iglesia en la cual el es pastor, junto a ellos viven sus tres hijos de 20, 13 y 9 años a quienes crían juntos y desean brindar una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Juan se dedica a trabajar como electricista. Cuando algún vecino, conocido o cliente nuevo desea implementar con nuevos cables su vivienda o realizar alguna instalación eléctrica, no dudan en llamar de inmediato a Juan ya que su trabajo se basa principalmente en electrificar las casas con todas las normas de seguridad. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 8 años de manera independiente, se inició trabajando en talleres particulares y fue de esta forma como aprendió y ganó mucha experiencia para poder hacerlo ahora con mucho esmero y responsabilidad. En ocasiones trabaja como mototaxista. Le esta yendo muy bien, frecuentemente recibe contratos laborales y siempre realiza su trabajo con resultados óptimos con sumo cuidado ya que no desea sufrir o generar accidentes que lamentar, además dedica el tiempo que le queda disponible para brindar orientación espiritual en su templo evangélico. Tiene sus ingresos económicos regulados de acuerdo a los trabajos que hace, desea seguir trabajando e implementar su equipo laboral con herramientas y accesorios que le permitan realizar su trabajo con mayor rapidez. Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, está muy contento por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a continuar pagando puntualmente sus cuotas tal como le programen, está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará algunos materiales y equipos que le hacen falta para su trabajo de electricista, por otro lado pagará una cuota económica más del mototaxi que compró.
texts.en:
Juan, 43 years old, is honest, hard-working, and above all, very responsible. He is married and lives with his wife and their 3 children, ages 20, 13, and 9, in a church where he is pastor. Juan and his wife wish to provide the children with a good education and a better quality of life. 

Juan works as an electrician. When a neighbor, acquaintance, or new customer wants to install new wiring in a house, or make an electrical installation, they don't hesitate to call Juan immediately. His work is principally based on the electrification of homes, with all the security norms. He has been doing this work independently for 8 years, after initially working for privately-owned shops. That's how he learned the skill and gained lots of experience, enabling him to work now with much expertise and responsibility. On occasions, he also works as a 'mototaxi' operator.

Things are going well for Juan. He frequently receives work contracts and always performs a job with optimal results and great care, since he doesn't want to suffer or cause lamentable accidents. Juan dedicates his remaining disposable time to offering spiritual guidance in his evangelical temple. His income depends on the work he has. He desires to continue working and expanding his work equipment with the tools and accessories that permit him to do his work much faster.

This is his 4th loan through MFP. Juan is very content with the financial help he has been offered, and he feels more secure about advancing his work. Also, he is committed to meeting his scheduled payments punctually. Juan is very glad to belong to his communal bank since all the members are responsible and supportive.

His solicited loan of 2,500 sols will be used to purchase materials and equipment he now lacks for his electrical work. Also, Juan will make another payment on the 'mototaxi' he bought.

loans.use: to buy materials and equipment he lacks for his work as an electrician.

loans.name: Katy

texts.es: Katy, de 42 años, es una mujer alegre, soñadora y muy emprendedora, esta casada desde hace varios años, fruto de su matrimonio nacieron tres hijos quienes ahora tienen 17, 15 y 8 años de edad respectivamente, vive en la casa de su suegra junto a los miembros de su familia. El trabajo de Katy consiste en la costura de disfraces ya que ella es una de las socias de un negocio de piñatas, disfraces y animaciones junto a sus dos amigas, ella realiza este trabajo en un local alquilado en un punto muy concurrido de la ciudad. Lleva 1 año en este trabajo y le esta yendo bien ya que junto a sus demás compañeras de inversión ponen todo el empeño y la creatividad que se necesita para cumplir óptimamente con esta labor. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede trabajar tranquilamente al lado de sus amigas y puede supervisar los resultados de su inversión de manera directa junto a sus socias, por fortuna tiene muy buenas ganancias ya que siempre tiene clientes, antes trabajaba en su casa con cierta cantidad de clientes, los mismos que ahora mantiene fieles a ella junto a los clientes nuevos que ha conseguido en este tiempo, espera mantener su negocio en crecimiento y agrandarlo con el paso de los meses. Este es el crédito numero 3 con MFP, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual y espera continuar trabajando con su banco comunal por el compañerismo y la solidaridad que muestran entre ellos cada uno de sus integrantes. El monto solicitado 1500 soles, lo utilizará para comprar materiales para su negocio como telas, botones, elásticos, hilos, blondas, esponjas, pinturas decorativas y otros accesorios.
texts.en:
Katy, 42 years old, is a happy woman, an idealist, and very enterprising. She has been married for some years and has three children aged 17, 15, and 8 years respectively. She lives in her mother-in-law’s house together with the members of her family.

Katy works sewing costumes as she is one of the business associates in a piñata, costume, and animation business along with her two friends. She works in a rented facility which is located at a very busy point of the city. She has been doing this work for one year and it is going well as she and her other investment partners are putting in all of the necessary effort and creativity in order to fulfill the work optimally.

What she likes about the work is that she can work quietly beside her friends and can oversee the results of her contributions immediately with her partners. Fortunately she has good earnings and always has customers. She used to work at home with a certain number of customers, and now they remain loyal to her along with new customers that she has gotten at this time, and she expects her business to continue growing and expanding as the months go by.

This is her third loan through MFP, so she is grateful to the people that provide the necessary financing so she can accomplish her plans, and on her part she promises to comply with the payment plan punctually and she hopes to continue working with the communal bank because of the fellowship and solidarity among all the members.

She will use the requested amount of 1500 soles to buy supplies for her business such as fabric, buttons, thread, lace, sponges, decorative paints and other accessories.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, elastic, thread, lace, sponges, decorative paints and other accessories for her business work

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy, de 48 años, es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y muy carismática, esta casada sin embargo actualmente se encuentra separada, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, vive solo con 2 de ellos además de su nuera y su dos nietos en la casa propia que construyo al lado de su esposo cuando vivían juntos. Ah aprendido a ser más fuerte con el paso de los años y por las experiencias que le ha tocado vivir. Lucy es una mujer que disfruta del trabajo, no le gusta estar inactiva es por eso que no desmaya cuanto de realizar alguna labor se trata. Su fuente de ingreso principal consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi, tiene 1 vehículo que compró gracias a los préstamos que le han otorgado, el mismo que es conducido por un chofer quien diariamente le entrega un monto económico por tal servicio. Lleva cerca de un año ejerciendo esta función. Sin embargo realiza otras actividades que también le generan ingresos económicos. Todo lo que realiza le gusta mucho y no duda en poner su mayor esfuerzo para trabajar cada día con mucho optimismo, su gran deseo ahora es refaccionar el tercer vehículo que por ahora tiene en estado de inactividad para hacerlo trabajar y complementar así su principal fuente de ingresos. Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, está muy contento por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a continuar pagando puntualmente sus cuotas tal como le programen, está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
El monto solicitado 1000 soles lo invertirá en el pago de una cuota que realiza mensualmente por la adquisición de su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Lucy, 48 years old, is an enterprising, hardworking, and very charismatic woman. She is married, but currently separated, and as three adult children. She lives with just two of them, in addition to her daughter-in-law and two grandchildren in the house that she and her husband built when they lived together.

She has learned to be stronger over the years because of her personal life experiences. Lucy is a woman who likes to work; she doesn't like to be inactive. For this reason, it does not bother her when there is work to do. Her main source of income consists of renting out a mototaxi. She has one vehicle that she bought, thanks to the loans she has been given. This vehicle is driven by a chauffeur who gives her a ride every day for the service. She has done this for about a year. However, she has other jobs that generate income as well. She enjoys everything she does and does not hesitate in putting her best effort into her work every day with optimism. 

Her greatest desire is to refurbish the third vehicle she has, which is currently not working. She wants to fix it and increase her main source of income. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She is very happy for the financial help that they are providing her so that she will feel confident in advancing her work. Also, she promises to continue making her payments punctually as they are arranged. She is happy to belong to a communal bank because everyone is responsible and supportive.

The requested loan sum is 1000 soles, which she will invest in making the monthly payments on her purchased mototaxi.

loans.use: to make the monthly payments on her purchased mototaxi.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moisés de 41 años, es soltero e independiente. Se desempeña, por un lado, como docente y por el otro como un gran productor de cacao en su zona. Sus años de trabajo le han traído consigo la posibilidad de poder construir de a poco una casa de material noble en un terreno que sus padres le cedieron al ver que era muy trabajador y honrado. Él como siempre trabajador y de espíritu emprendedor, pues no quería conformarse con el trabajo de docente, pues la oportunidad de ser productor, pues sus padres le cedieron unas tierras, y es así que hace 17 años se dedica al cultivo de cacao. No obstante dentro de las limitaciones encontradas es que justamente el terreno no es muy extenso como él lo desearía, actualmente esta en temporada de cosecha y es necesario anticipar la compra de sacos de abono natural a los proveedores y contratar jornaleros que ayuden en el deshierbo de maleza y lograr obtener en la próxima temporada una cosecha de calidad. Esperando desde ya que en el futuro algún vecino se ofrezca en vender algún terreno para así cumplir su anhelo. Con su préstamo numero 09 se siente agradecido por la confianza, adicionalmente a ello tuvo la oportunidad de liderar su banco comunal  en mas de una ocasión y nos comenta que lo volvería a hacer con mucho gusto. Los 2,500 soles los esta destinando para la compra de los sacos de abonos orgánicos y el adelanto para el pago de los jornaleros que desyerbaran la maleza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Moisés, 41, is single and independent.  He works as a teacher and as a big producer of cacao in his area.  His years of work have given him the possibility of being able to build, little by little, a house of good materials on a piece of land his parents gave to him when they saw how hardworking and honest he was.  

He has always been a hard worker with an entrepreneurial spirit.  He didn't want to be content with his work as a teacher because of the opportunity to be a grower when his parents transferred some land to him.  This is how he has been a cacao grower for 17 years.

Nevertheless, one of the limitations he has is that his plot of land isn't as extensive as he would like.  He hopes that in the future some neighbor might offer to sell him some land so he can realize his goal.

Currently it's harvest season and he needs to pay his suppliers in advance for sacks of natural fertilizer and hire day laborers to weed, thus managing to have a quality harvest next season. 

He's grateful for the trust with his ninth loan.  He also had the opportunity to lead his communal bank on more than one occasion, and he says he'd do it again with great pleasure.

He's going to use the 2,500 soles [PEN] to buy sacks of organic fertilizer and to pay the day laborers who are going to weed the crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and to pay day laborers

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru: Ольга - предприниметель из Каменки-Днепровки. Предыдущий кредит помог Ольге приобрести семена и удобрения для торговли. У ее покупателей была возможность выбрать все, что им необходимо для их бизнеса. Сегодня бизнес Ольги продолжает успешно развиваться дальше. Ольга просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки мото-культиваторов и семян. Планирует вложить большую часть прибыли в развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Olga is an entrepreneur from Kamenka-Dneprovskaya. The previous loan helped Olga purchase seeds and fertilizer for trade. Her customers had the opportunity to choose anything they needed for their businesses. 

Currently Olga's business continues to develop successfully further. Olga requests to get a loan for the purchase of moto-cultivators and seeds. She plans to invest the largest part of the income in developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase moto-cultivators and seeds for selling

loans.name: Hak's Group

texts.en:
Hak, 43 years old, lives in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province in Cambodia. She is married and blessed with six children, some of whom are school-aged children, while others are yet too young to attend school. Hak earns income for the family by growing rice, a business she has been involved in for more than 20 years. Each day she is able to earn approximately 25,000KHR.

This is her first time requesting a loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is leading a group member, Sarom, to apply for a loan in the amount of 600,000KHR and 1,400,000KHR respectively. Hak plans on using a portion of her requested loan to purchase fertilizer for her farmland and the other portion to buy bicycles to support her children’s transportation from home to school.

Hak would like to dedicate all of the effort she has put into her business to educating her children and moving her family ahead.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia, de 31 años, es una mujer muy alegre, amable y emprendedora, esta felizmente casada y tiene una casa propia en donde vive junto a su esposo y sus tres pequeños hijos a quienes quiere dar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Patricia consiste en la animación de fiesta infantiles y otros eventos, además ella tiene un negocio en el cual vende piñatas, alquila disfraces para toda ocasión y brinda el servicio de buffets para los eventos y acontecimientos que le soliciten. Tiene un local acondicionado en su propia vivienda. Lleva 2 años con este negocio y trabaja con la ayuda de 2 señoras que le apoyan en la confección de los disfraces y se convirtieron en socias estratégicas del negocio. Empezó solo haciendo animaciones y esta creciendo cada vez más. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disponer de su tiempo, además que al tener a sus amigas a su lado en el negocio se siente tranquila por que confía en ellas y esta segura que juntas seguirán su camino hacia el progreso. Espera más adelante poder agrandar su negocio ya que le va muy bien y a veces le falta algunos disfraces por que tiene muchos clientes. Este es el préstamo número 5 con MFP, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual y continuar trabajando con mucha responsabilidad junto a los miembros de su banco comunal. 
Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, ella comprará telas, accesorios, materiales para hacer disfraces y arreglar algunas botas de animación que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Patricia is 31 years old. She is a happy, friendly, and enterprising woman. She is happily married and has her own house where she lives with her husband and her three small children whom she wants to offer a good quality of life.

Patricia’s work consists of cartooning for children’s parties and other events, and she has a business where she sells piñatas, rents costumes for all occasions, and offers buffet services for requested events. She has a fitted-out facility in her own home. She has been doing this for two years and works with the help of two ladies that support her in the making of costumes and they have become strategic business partners. She just began making cartoons and is continually growing.

What she likes about her work is that she can arrange her time, and also having her friends at her side in the business she feels peaceful because she trusts them and is sure that together they will follow the road towards progress. She hopes that later she can expand her business and it is going very well although at times she lacks some costumes because she has so many customers. 

This is her fifth loan through MFP, and she is very grateful for the loan opportunity given her and for the financial backing that she needs to get ahead. She promises to pay her monthly payments in a punctual manner and to continue working very responsibly together with the members of her communal bank. 

With the amount requested of 3000 soles, she will buy fabric, accessories, and supplies in order to make costumes and to repair some cartoon boots that she has waiting.

loans.use: to buy fabric, accessories, and supplies to make costumes and to repair some cartoon boots she has waiting in her business

loans.name: Corali Estrella

texts.es: Corali, es una joven mamá, que por su pequeña niña se vio obligada a generar ingresos,  sus padres le ayudaron brindándole un espacio en su  casa, habilitando el mismo para instalar una tiendita de barrio, en la misma tiene variedad de productos para la venta. Corali, se levanta a las 6:00 de la mañana para abrir su tienda, es a esa hora que los proveedores de pan llegan para hacerle entrega del mismo, y desde esa hora ella empieza la atención en su tienda. Acompañada de su hijita, todo el día atiende a todas las personas que son vecinos, y otros que a su paso necesitan comprar algún producto de la tienda. Necesita el crédito para abastecer su negocio, pues en ocasiones por falta de capital de operación la tienda no tiene suficiente surtido. Ella sueña con tener algún día su propia familia, también desea ir a la Universidad, pero por el momento su bebé es pequeño y  no tiene con quien dejarla para su cuidado, sus padres le apoyan brindándole vivienda, pero ellos también trabajan y salen de la casa generalmente todo el día. Ella se ve obligada a cuidar de su bebe y atender su tienda que es su único y principal fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Corali is a young mother who needs to generate income to support her daughter. Her parents have helped her by giving her space in their house for a store where she sells a variety of products. Corali gets up at 6:00 a.m. to open her store because that is when her bread suppliers deliver to her. From then on, she serves her customers with her young child at her side. All day she serves her neighbors and other people who needs to purchase items at the store.

Corali needs the loan to stock her business, as at times she lacks operating capital and the store is understocked. She dreams of having her own family and going to college, but for now her baby is young, and she has no one to take care of her. Her parents help her with housing, but they also work and leave the house for the entire day. She must care for the baby and watch the store because it is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.ru:
Виктория замужем, имеет одну шестилетнюю дочь.

Виктория торгует мужской одеждой на центральном рынке города Мелитополь. Она имеет свое торговое место. Опыт работы - 5 лет. За это время у Виктории были и взлеты и падения в бизнесе. При этом ее трудолюбие и желание развивать бизнес помогали ей идти вперед.

Виктория просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки товара - спортивных брюк, джинсов, свитеров. Она надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить свои жилищные условия.
texts.en:
Victoria is married and has a six year old daughter. Victoria sells men's clothing at the central market of the city of Melitopol. She has her own sales stall. 

She has 5 years of experience in this work. During this time, Victoria has had both ups and downs in the business. In this, her hard working and the desire to develop her business helped her move forward. 

Victoria request a loan for the purchase of goods - sports pants, jeans and sweaters. She hopes to get an additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sports pants, jeans and sweaters for selling

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru: Ирина - предприниматель из Мелитополя, которая торгует одеждой на рынке. У нее свой хорошо оборудованный киоск. Торговля также идет хорошо. Ирина просит предоставить ей кредит на закупку дополнительного товара. Это поможет ей увеличить оборот и не упустить сезунную бизнес возможность. Дополнительную прибыль Ирина планирует потратить на свою семью. Живет она с мужем и двумя сыновьями.
texts.en:
Irina is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, who sells clothing at the market. She has her own well-equipped sales point. The sale is going very well.

Irina requests a loan for the purchase of additional goods. This will help her increase the turnover and not miss seasonal business opportunities. Irina plans to spend the additional income on her family. She lives with her husband and two sons.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her clothing stall

loans.name: Peñitas Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO PEÑITAS ES UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO DE CREDITUYO, ESTA INTEGRADO POR 5 PERSONAS SON AMIGAS Y VECINAS DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS TODAS ELLAS SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO,SUS NOMBRES SON,IMELDA ,MARIA DE LA LUZ, MARIA DEL CARMEN,YADIRA Y YAZMIN.
 IMELDA ESTA CASADA DESDE HACE MAS DE 10 AÑOS, TIEN 2 HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE HAMBURGUESAS LOS FINES DE SEMANA, EN SU DOMICILIO IMELDA TIENE MUCHAS ASPIRACIONES PARA ELLA Y SUS HIJOS, YA QUE CON SU TRABAJO PIENSA AHORRAR DINERO PARA UN FUTURO MEJOR PARA ELLOS, Y QUE ESTUDIEN UNA CAERRERA YA QUE ELLA NO TUBO LA OPORTUNIDAD DE ESTUDIAR.IMELDA PIENSA UTILIZAR SU PRESTAMO, EN AGRANDAR SU LOCAL PARA TENER MAYOR ESPACIO Y ATENDER MEJOR A SUS CLIENTES Y QUE SE LE INCREMENTEN SUS VENTAS.
texts.en:
The communal bank PEÑITAS is working with Credituyo. The members, who have been friends, neighbors, and merchants for years are: Imelda, Maria de la Luz, Maria del Carmen, Yadira, and Yazmin. Imelda has been married for more than 10 years and has two young children. She sells hamburgers on weekends from her house. 

She has aspirations for herself and her children. She believes that with her savings from work she can offer her children a brighter future and that they can learn a profession, an opportunity not available to her. Imelda will use the loan to expand her space and improve her service so that she can increase sales.

loans.use: to make their space larger.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 36-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has four children ages 17, 14, 11 and 8. All of them are in school. She has two additional dependents who live with her for schooling. In 2002, Fatmata established her plastic and leather slippers business. She began her business because she wanted to provide support to her husband and a source of income. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy plastic shoes and leather shoes. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 185,000. In the future, Fatmata plans to educate her children, to develop her table into a shop, and to own a house. She thanks lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy plastic and leather shoes to resell

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: El señor Gerardo es nacido en la comunidad de Kaspicancha Baja de la Provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba, actualmente es natural de lugar y vive junto a su esposa que tienen tres hijos menores a su custodia, actualmente está viviendo en su casa que es una casa rustico que está construido de adobe con techo de paja con piso y revoque de barro. El cliente en realidad se dedica a la actividad agrícola cultiva los tubérculos y cereales su comunidad es la parte mas alta del Municipio, al mismo tiempo el crédito que están solicitando es para comprar abono de gallina y compra de arboles para sembrar esta año, asimismo el necesita para aumentar su producto. La comunidad del don Gerardo se encuentra aproximadamente a 8 km al este de la población de Tiraque.
texts.en: Gerardo was born in the community of Kaspicancha Baja in the province of Tiraque in the department of Cochabamba. He currently lives in the same place along with his wife and they have 3 children in their care. He is currently living in his home which is a rustic house made of adobe with a thatched roof and an earth floor. This client works in agriculture, growing root vegetables and cereals. His community is the highest part of the municipality. He is requesting a loan to buy manure fertilizer and to buy trees to plant this year. He needs these to increase his production. Don Gerado's community can be found about 8 km to the east of the town of Tiraque.

loans.use: to buy manure fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: This is 47-year-old Nancy.  She is married and has three children ages 25, 19 and 16. All of them are in school. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her for proper care. In 1998, Nancy established her cosmetics, suitcase, Coleman clothing and textiles business. She began her business just to enable her to provide some of her basic needs and as a source of income. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about Le 650,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Nancy has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and she now requires a new loan in order to buy perfume, shampoo, jeans, trousers and mobile phones. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. In the future, Nancy plans to start running to Dubai for business and to give her children quality education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, suitcases and DVDs.

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en: This is 54-year-old Alusine. He is married and has three children ages 4, 9 and 15. He has two additional dependents who live with him to help, his wife's younger brother and sister. In 2004, Alusine established his building materials and scrap metals business. The business started to be self-reliant after spending most of his time at the mines. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Alusine has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and he now requires a new loan in order to buy an additional window frame and cement. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 291,720. In the future, Alusine plans to move from his tight shop to a spacious shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for cement and scrap metal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise such as jackets for children.

loans.name: Las Fresas Del Algodonal Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Gladys es  miembro  del grupo Las Fresas del Algodonal
Este grupo va por su  tercer ciclo, todas las socias de esta alcancía son amigas y vecinas de mismo lugar. La Sra. Gladys es una de las socias, ella es viuda y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad que son independientes. Ella se dedica al negocio del transporte público. La Sra. Gladys ahorro durante mucho tiempo para poder comprarse un moto taxi, con el dinero del alquiler siguió juntando y en la actualidad cuenta con 2 unidades, los ingresos que percibe por el alquiler son muy importantes; porque ella sola sustenta sus gastos. Con el  préstamo que ha solicitado podrá completar para comprar su próxima moto y así continuar con su sueño de tener varias unidades. La Sra. Gladys está muy agradecida a EDAPROSPO  por su préstamo, porque sin él habría demorado para comprar sus motos, también quiere hacer extensivo el agradecimiento a los inversores de KIVA que sin conocerla confían en ella y su grupo.


*La Sra. Gladys viste casaca negra.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the group Las Fresas del Algodonal.
This group is going into its third loan cycle. All the members of this loan group are friends and neighbors in the same place. Gladys is one of the members. She is widowed and has 3 grown children who are independent. She has a public transportation business. Gladys saved for a long time to be able to buy herself a motorcycle taxi. She continued saving money when she rented this out, and now she has two units. The income she gets from the rental is very important as she is the only person covering her expenses. She will use the loan that she has requested to buy her next motorcycle taxi and, in this way, continue her dream of having a number of vehicles. Gladys is grateful to EDAPROSPO for the loan because, without it, she would have been delayed in buying her motorcycle taxis. She also wants to extend her thanks to the KIVA lenders who have trusted her and the group without knowing them. 
Gladys is wearing a black jacket in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.en:
Wilmer, who is a farmer, lives happily in Manalo with his spouse and two children, who attend school. He plants and harvests rice to sell from a half-hectare rice field. His loving wife also helps him in managing the business. 

Wilmer is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy pesticides and insecticides to use in the farming business. This will help ensure the good growth of crops and so that someday they can be harvested abundantly. This will help generate the profits necessary to pay matriculation fees on time.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and insecticides to use in his farming business.

loans.name: Zarela

texts.es:
Zarela, de 40 años, es una mujer luchadora, amable y muy trabajadora, está casada con Antonio y junto a él tiene tres hijos siendo 2 de ellos mayores de edad e independientes, actualmente vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su hija menor encaminando todos sus esfuerzos y sacrificios para mejorar su calidad de vida.
El trabajo de Zarela consiste en la venta de golosinas, bebidas, frutas y comida que solicitan los niños en la escuela donde trabaja, posee un pequeño puesto de ventas en el interior del centro de estudios que alquila pagando mensualmente. Ahí se encarga de trabajar durante el día desde las 7.00 de la mañana hasta las 6.00 de la tarde. Lleva en este negocio más de 3 años y desde que empezó a realizarlo siempre lo ha hecho sola.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para realizar otras actividades, como por ejemplo atender a su hija y apoyarla en sus actividades académicas. Espera aumentar la variedad de productos en su negocio y continuar en la ruta del éxito y la prosperidad por el bien de su familia. Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en el crédito anterior que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000), comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas, bebidas, frutas y otros productos que consumen los niños, de esta forma espera mantener estable sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Zarela, 40, is a pleasant and hardworking woman and a fighter.  She's married to Antonio and with him has three children, two of them adults and independent.  Currently she lives in her own house with her husband and her younger daughter, chanelling all her effort and sacrifice into improving their quality of life.

Zarela's job is selling sweets, beverages, fruit, and food that children request in the school where she works.  She pays a monthly rent on a small sales stall inside the school.  She works there from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m.  She has had this business for more than three years and always has done it alone.  What she likes most about her job is the freedom she has to do other things, such as taking care of her daughter and helping her with her academic work.  She hopes to increase the variety of products she sells and continue on the road to success and prosperity for the well-being of her family.

This is her second loan with MFP, for which she thanks all the people who make it possible to continue working with better results.  She also pledges once again to make her payments punctually, just as she did with her previous loan.  In addition, she likes to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.

With the requested amount (1000 soles [PEN]), she'll make bulk purchases of sweets, beverages, fruit, and other products that children eat and drink.  This way she hopes to keep her income stable.

loans.use: to buy sweets, beverages, fruit, and other products that children eat and drink

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is married, has three children, and raises rice crops as his source of income. His wife also helps him in managing the farming business. From a hectare ricefield, he usually gains about 10,000 PHP each harvest season (twice a year). 

He is now asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to invest in buying rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to ensure the good growth of crops and to harvest rice crops abundantly.

Ronald would like to keep achieving abundant harvests and someday save funds to provide a good education to his three children.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for his farming business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Hawa. She is married and has four children, ages 17, 15, 13 and 9. She has one additional dependent who lives with her – that is her mother. She is staying with her because she is aged.  

In 1992, Hawa established her clothing and textiles business. She began her business because she wants to provide support to her husband in running their home and this is one of her major sources of income. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 600,000 leones (SLL) every month from her business. 

Hawa would like a loan of 4,000,000 SLL. Hawa has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy lace material, English wax cotton and dry cotton. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 320,000 SLL. In the future, Hawa plans to start running to Conakry for business, to complete the construction of her house and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy lace material, English wax cotton and dry cotton.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga was born in 1964. She has three children. Her sons are a worker and a carpenter. Her daughter has gotten married. Her husband is a constructor. 

Nga sells traditional bamboo shoots for a living. She makes 3,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 12,000,000 VND per month.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to sell bamboo shoots. Her dream is to upgrade and enlarge her food stall of bamboo shoots.

loans.use: to sell bamboo shoots.

loans.name: Ninh

texts.en:
Ninh was born in 1958. She has three children who are learning at university and working for a factory. Her husband is dead. She sells pork and traditional pork food in the market to earn a living. She makes 3,500,000 dong (VND) a month from it. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month. 

Ninh has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to sell pork in the market. She always wants to let her children go to school till higher education.

loans.use: to sell pork in the market.

loans.name: Loan's Group

texts.en:
Loan was born in 1970. She has three children. Her youngest daughter is learning at secondary school, her son is a carpenter, and her oldest daughter has gotten married. Loan and her husband are divorced. 

Loan sells pork in a market to earn a living. She gains 4,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,048,000 VND to support her son in learning and doing carpentry. Her dream is to let her children have good careers.

Other members who are part of Loan's group include the following:
Thang has two children. She does carpentry to earn a living. She wants to borrow 6,048,000 VND to do her job. 
Binh has two children. She raises pigs to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise pigs for selling.
Lien has a child. She sells candies and snacks for a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to learn and do carpentry.

loans.use: to support her son in learning and doing carpentry.

loans.name: Nereo

texts.en:
Nereo lives in Cataggaman with his wife and five children. He is married to Amalia, a house keeper. In order to generate income for the family, he sells fruits and vegetables to the people in his village. He rented a small stall at the public market, and from selling his merchandise he generates about 10,000 PHP. 

He aspires to increase his income in order to diversify his business. He is now asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more bananas, potatoes, eggplant, beans, and cabbages to sell. His wife also helps him manage the business. 

With good funds and continuous hard work, he hopes to achieve a progressive life for his family someday.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, potatoes, eggplant, beans, and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a very industrious mother who manages a stall in a public market.  She sells meat for income. She is married to Bernard who helps her run the business. She is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy more pork and beef to sell. This will help increase her sales and bring in more income. Someday she hopes to become a successful meat vendor and give the best education to her two children as the only legacy she can pass on to them.

loans.use: to buy more pork and beef meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for buying more items such as airtime, soap, etc., for his general store.

loans.name: Osinatu

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Osinatu. She is married and has two children, ages 18 and 14. In 1994, Osinatu established her clothing and textiles business. She began her business because she wants to generate enough cash to support her children and this is her only source of livelihood. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 530,000 leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

Osinatu would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Osinatu requires a loan in order to buy window cotton, obama wax, and simple lace and guarantee wax. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 260,000 SLL. In the future, Osinatu plans to educate her kids, to develop her plot of land, and to rent a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy window cotton, obama wax, and simple lace and guarantee wax.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a 25 year-old businesswoman.  She benefited a lot from the previous loan in the following ways: she has increased her business stock, paid part of her children's school fees, and is looking forward to getting more loans in the years to come.  She is very happy that Finance Sudan services the community.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more grinding machines.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, a 38-year-old businesswoman, has benefited greatly from her previous loans in the following ways: she has increased her stock; paid part of her children's school fees, and is now planning to build a house for her children.

Now requesting this loan to purchase more items to sell, Florence is happy for the support she has received allowing her to continue with her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like beans, eggs, cooking oil, tomato paste, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items like meat, rice, soda, water, etc.

loans.name: Sokiri

texts.en:
Sokiri is a 26-year-old businessman. He says that he benefited a lot from the previous loan. He has increased his stock, made more profit, and is now planning to send one of his children to school.

Sokiri says that he is happy to receive another loan from Finance Sudan to increase his store inventory.

loans.use: to purchase more items like utensils, bags, earrings, cosmetics and many other inventory items.

loans.name: Guapas Group

texts.es: Las Guapas son un grupo de puras mujeres muy guapas, van en su 5° ciclo y todas son responsables y trabajadoras.Guadalupe en una de las integrantes del grupo, tiene 39 años de edad, vive en unión libre junto con sus 3 hijos de 25, 11 y 2 años; ella se dedica a la venta de herramientas de segunda en mercados rodantes, el crédito la ayudara surtir las mismas para poder incrementar sus ventas para estar mejor económicamente. Guadalupe desea poner una ferretería de 1° en unos 2 años por que desea progresar mas con su negocio y para no descuidar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Las Guapas is a group of very beautiful women. They are on their fifth loan cycle and they are all very responsible and hard-working.

Guadalupe is one of the members of the group. She is 39 years old and is in a civil union. She lives with her three children, who are 25, 11, and 2 years of age. She makes a living by selling second-hand tools in street markets. The loan will help her to supply the tools so she can increase her sales and be better off economically. Guadalupe wants to set up a first-rate hardware store in a few years because she wants to progress more with her business and because she does not want to neglect her children.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand tools

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 28-year-old businessman who benefited from his previous loan by increasing both his stock and his profits. Taking another loan to continue expanding his business, he says that he is happy for Finance Sudan's ongoing support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like radios, dry cells, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 43 years old and is from a small village in the Vani district. He lives with his 38-year-old wife and 3 children (13, 11 and 1 years old). The family runs an agricultural business. They have 2 dairy cows and a calf, whose cheese is sold at the local open market. They also have a pig, which produces piglets and they are sold in their village. In addition, the family has a nut garden. They sell on average 600 kg harvested nuts per year. Levan is also involved in a flower trading business. He transports the flowers to nearby countries with his own mini-bus and sells them at a good price.

Levan has requested a loan to purchase flowers for resell. He will increase his stocks and will be able to transport more flowers and expand his trading. This will significantly increase the profit of the family. The increased income will be reinvested in family's agricultural activities. In particular, he will purchase additional cattle to produce more dairy products and increase the monthly income from sales. Levan will improve the living conditions for the family, as well as finance the education of his children to ensure a better future for them.

loans.use: to purchase flowers for resell

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Ms. Samina is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She is been in the business of hand embroidery for 3 years. Due to the insufficient income of her husband she is working hard to help meet the expenses of the family members. Samina has gotten a lot of appreciation in her community through her versatile patterns of embroidery. Samina makes enough to lead a decent life. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for two years. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the foundation. To cope with the increasing demand, she has requested a loan of Rs. 45,000 to purchase reels of threads in different colors and packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material for embellishment. She dreams to open a shop in her community to display her work. She is hopeful to earn more profits and intends to utilize the part of it for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase thread in different colors and packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material for embellishment.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en: Lita is a responsible housewife who supports her husband in generating income for the sake of their family. She is 52 years old and has five grown-up children. Two of them are still studying and they want them to earn a degree so that they will be employed someday. Despite financial difficulty, they have the strong determination to upgrade their standard of living to give their children a better life.
